column5: A big well done from me to the Dagenham East staff who served a gentleman who had learning difficulties and a lady in a motorised wheelchair while I was in the shop today.  The lady s shopping was brought round in bags and hung on her chair and she was offered help to make sure nothing was in her way as she left.   The gentleman was served with acceptance and respect and was chatted to and treated totally as an equal.  The staff were all so naturally welcoming and obviously do this sort of thing all the time - good for them!
been one by Tesco not happy

Just wanted to say how good and kind the staff are in our Saxmundham Tesco. tonight I went in my daughter fell over I was needing to pick up my click and collect and it was rather large  very kindly they took it and my shopping to the car for me so I could carry my daughter. Thank you to Saxmundham Tesco and the employer that helped
Oh Tesco Tesco Tesco. I am so disappointed. Perhaps you can help??!!  Why oh why oh why have you removed Bournville Dark Chocolate from sale in all of your stores???
Could you please confirm whether these Lunchbox Suggestions promo boxes that are being sent out to Online customers are also being given to customers that shop in store.   Thanks.

Getting asked for ID on alcohol in my local Tesco when the person behind the counter isn t old enough to serve me she gets a nod from the supervisor to say it s ok does that mean I can get a nod from my mate to say I m ok to buy it instead too ?!

Dear Tesco    I was so happy to pick up a packet of your delicious custard donuts yesterday (as i cam never find them anywhere else) I was eager to dive into them today! So you can imagine at lunch time I was delighted to bite into it and taste the delicious custard flavour  yum!.... My girlfriend on the otherhand....not so lucky as hers from the same packet was apple flavour..Yuk! Anyway you ll be pleased to know I finally calmed her down and I stuck up for you Tesco  I offered her the rest of mine and I said it must just be a one off. Anyway we fancied a snack this evening....I know we re fatties so dived into the pack again and I joked.... wouldn t it be funny if yours was apple again?  Well Tesco you got some explaining to do and owe us two custard donuts because I had to give my girlfriend the rest of mine...AGAIN!! Two Apple donuts in a pack of 5 custards is just not on. There was no sticking up for you this time I m affrad. And the worst part....we had to eat the last one just to make sure it wasn t apple! Please Tesco I need some custard donuts in my life!!

Hi Tesco    I d like to make a complaint about one of your lorry drivers who was driving so dangerously in the Goodmayes area this evening. Pulling out dangerously and tailgating a bus  swerving all over the road. Absolutely shocking! I have the registration number of the van though.  Is there a number to call or an email address to report this please? I ve checked the Tesco website and it s impossible to find a number to ring!   Please let me know.

Thank you for arranging collection of my faulty pool for today.....shame that I wasted the whole day and nobody turned up. This causes a delay for me getting my money back and me being expected to waste another day waiting around. Not happy

A massive thank you to  Jill  from your Sunbury branch who made my daughters day today. My daughter (4 years old) has a broken leg from a combination of; her brother  a firemans lift and a trampoline (it was never going to end well). This has made her summer holidays suck somewhat. Jill noticed her whilst in store today and came over to talk to her about it all. My little one explained we had glitter in our trolley so we could make her cast both girly and sparkly. Jill did no more than remove the item from our scanned items list and told us it was on her. I realise a couple of quid to Tesco is nothing but it was the humanity that counted. My girl was over the moon  particularly when Jill said she was her  hero of the day .  Sometimes Tesco you can be a big faceless organisation with profit and loss reported daily as if it s life or death  don t forget the wonderful people who make your cogs turn. Thank you  Jill . X

Tried to return my faulty blaupunkt tv to the Chorley store last week but was told the technology department was closed. The store was open (24 hours) but that department was closed so I was told to call back anytime before 8pm. Couldn t customer service just deal with it? Very annoying!  I thought I d try the other store about a mile away buckshaw tesco  this store hasn t got a technology department but were more than happy to give me a replacement. How s that work? A bit of consistency please tesco!  My first tv lasted 3 weeks my replacement 2 weeks. Same fault same TV. I returned it to buckshaw today and was told to ring blaupunkt. The lady behind customer services (not the technology dept they don t have one)  shell  rang them for me. Blaupunkt told me it was a known fault and to address it they would send me a link via email containing a software update that I would have to load onto a USB and put into my tv. I don t own a USB stick or a laptop to do this and why should I anyway? I told shell I just wanted a refund as it was the 2nd Tv and that I had bought a replacement already from argos as the TV was for my elderly father and I didn t want to leave him without a to. Shell then had to ring tesco tech department explained the situation and passed me over. They decided they couldn t do anything as blaupunkt had givin me a resolution. I explained I didn t have a USB or a laptop or the time to be messing. They suggested I buy a USB and go to a public library to download the software and update my tv. Really? You are selling faulty TVs (comfirmed by blaupunkt) and expecting you d customers to fix them themselves? Surely they should be recalled by tesco  updated by blaupunkt and then put back on your shelves? The tech department said the decision was final and that was that. Luckily shell agreed with me that the situation was ridiculous and that I shouldn t have to go to a public library to download software that should already be on the tv and called  duty  Alex. He was a very helpful young man and my tv was refunded. Alex and shell are a credit to the store.  So my complaint.   All stores should be able to return any goods even if the department is closed.   I made 5 trips to two stores to buy 1 tv.  I was in the store for well over 30 mins which to me should have been an in and out refund.  The tech support team are useless and very unhelpful.  You are selling faulty TVs!  A terrible shopping experience.  A big thankyou to shell for her patience and Alex for his understanding and humanity!

I bought some jam donuts from your store in Bridlington today  they re my dads favourite and he was greatly disappointed when he took a bite in to one and found it didn t have any jam in...  Funny jam donut! üòÇ

Hello   I would like to ask a question regarding applying for jobs on the Tesco website. I have applied for several vacancies  two today  through your site and after getting the  Thank you  message I click on the site dashboard and it lists the application as unsuccessful directly after I ve sent it!   Are applications actually even looked at?
Hi  iv transfered my eon reward points into tesco clubcard points  I was wondering how long it takes for them to show on my account? Thank you

Tesco why does your Bridge of Don Aberdeen store never stock aubergine? I ve been shopping there for a year and not even seen an out of stock shelf edge for it! My aubergine and sweet potato chilli is missing a vital ingredient!   Give me the üçÜüçÜüçÜüçÜ

hello Tesco  the official complaint form would not allow me to exceed 1000 words  so I shall use this as way for voicing my concern. I would like to see a change to the recipe of your frozen potato croquettes  i have not had any trouble with any other brand of croquettes besides tescos brand. The issue is they simply do not cook very well with many cooking methods. in the oven i follow the instructions and cook to specifications  they still look as though they came out the packet. so i performed a test and cooked another brand of croquettes and they cooked in far less time and actually looked as if they where cooked. Whereas your brand where just very hard and didn t look appealing  nor taste as if fully cooked. i then tried frying  again the other brands where no problem they cooked perfectly fine. but yours where still ice cold on the inside although browned on the outside  on further attempts i cooked them at a much lower temperature to heat them through and fryed them slowly at the higher temperature . although cooked well throughout and outside the coating was way too hard on them. so in a sort of conclusion to these light tests i have determined that maybe the recipe of the coating of the croquettes should be chnaged  the potatoe on the inside is fine as it is simply mashed potatoe and that cooks fine. if anyone else hads ahd issues with tesco brand croquettes give this a like and we shall see if tesco listen and offer up a new improved recipe.
I want to order some clothes and know that I can return any unwanted instore - does it have to be a store that sells clothes or can I return to one that doesn t?
Home delivery just arrive excellent service #wtgtesconewry
Got our shopping delivered on Sunday 28th. Just got around to use my cheese topped baps but they had mould on them  turns out were out of date when they arrived.

Once again  my shopping has been delivered without the Freixinet Ice Cuvee Especial (2 bottles) and I want to know what you propose doing about it. Order no. 164354928 You may have noticed a slight drop in business last month and thats because I find these issues tiresome and go to the new ASDA in Ware instead  which is a two minute drive away. Thank you.

Just been to Tesco Greenfield met the Manager Mark what a very nice guy  the previous managers are not a patch on this guy. He has gone out of his way today to help...... Its all about knowledge and finding out what the shopper wants  being seen on the shop floor working with the other staff and introducing himself to the shopper. Well done Mark this guy has put my faith back in Tesco Greenfield keep up this manner and I am sure you may get back some of the shoppers that now go elsewhere to do their shopping
Just had a prompt  courteous delivery. Thank you  Tesco!

Would like to say a big thank you to Tesco Spytty Newport Gwent  for the service I received in the in-store photo shop  after being let down by another company  then had problems trying to download my photos for my Mum and Dads Golden Wedding Anniversary from my phone  the assistant was absolutely outstanding  it was very busy she was on her own  kept coming over to make sure I was ok  told her what was happening  the assistant trying to help me and serve  after about hour she finally got the pictures I wanted  she told me it was a great idea what I was doing and told her it has been very hard as some companies had let me down on other things as well  so at one point I had no gift at all  came out relived and very satisfied. One very happy customer please can you pass it on Tesco  this was on Wednesday 31st August 11.30 am  as I think she deserves a special award for outstanding service please. ..

Totally disgusted with Tesco Shoreham!! A lady laying in the doorway with one shoe on looking dazed! Over a step away from her were two members of staff male and female! The security guard walking up and down! When I asked this lady if she was ok she cried help! Your security guard told me to go away! The two members of staff told me she was fine! She was NOT fine! I don t know or care if she had done wrong in the shop or a normal customer but you DON T treat anyone like that! It s wrong and as a result you won t see me there again! Totally angry at the way this woman was treated!
How can I leave feedback about someone on a till when I didn t get their name?
üò° I ve just found a catapilar in my sandwich

Disappointing that my grocery delivery arrived with almost ALL my fresh produce with use by date being tomorrow/2nd   stale bread to - none of it noted or mentioned by the driver or receipt - but thanks to the lovely advisor at .com who has helped to try and sort this out for me -
keep messing up my posts  just because they lie through their teeth
hat ever you do DONT go Tesco mobile they mis-sell  then send threats by email and mail when you have left their lie driven service

A couple of weeks ago my 7yr old autistic sons hudl2 stopped charging. Tesco collected it to fix it for him. It was returned yesterday but unfortunately it was broken! The screen had been cracked! I rang for help straight away and explained that my son had already gone 10 days without it and was now in full on meltdown due to it being returned broken. The kind man on the phone got his managers permission to give me a full refund instead of waiting for another repair!! Thank you tesco for understanding the importance of a working tablet to an autistic child!! My son picked a new tablet this morning  he picked 1 that was in the sale and had enough (with a couple of extra pound from mum!) to buy his brother one too!!

Thank you to the staff at Tesco Extra in Stretford for finding our much loved toy rabbit  lost by my daughter whilst doing our shop this morning. The staff went above and beyond to help when I told them we d dropped it somewhere in store. From  one very relieved mother!!  P.S. Love the free fruit for kids whilst you shop initiative. What a great idea!

Bit frustrated. We have your midweek delivery saver plan but wanted to change to the anytime plan as we have a few things coming up that this would be useful for. Why can we not upgrade immediately rather than wait till the current plan runs out in November? I could understand if we wanted to go to a lesser plan  but we re wanting to give you more money!
Thanks you!!! kids was very happy with the free box of goodies X feed your little monster box and the lovely driver put a big smile on are faces X Thanks xxxxx

I try to buy British whenever I can to support our farmers. I have been a customer of Tesco for many years  so imagine my surprise when I went to buy tomatoes I could only find 1 variety grown in the UK out of 12 different packs. These were  on the vine salad toms  all the others on display were from Italy  France and Spain. WHY in the middle of the Summer do you not supply British. I then went round looking at other fruit and veg and found that approx 60% were of other than UK origin. I always thought Tesco supported UK farmers  and when I queried this with management was informed that  Tesco always did what was best for the customers pricewise  NOT an answer!!! Comments please.

I am totally disappointed with the service you have failed to provide. I ordered 4 uniform items last Friday morning and the order is still being processed. How after  5 days is it so difficult to pick up the items I ordered which were not uncommon and post them. I will not shop online with you again. And yes I ve tried emailing the company. TWICE.

Think your Cherry Bakewell plaits need to come with a warning !!! i nearly broke a tooth on a cherry stone :( !! there is no warning on the package to say   may contain stones   !! Was 1st time & last of buying this  pity as it sounded nice & hadn t seen them before

Been waiting half hr for a click and collect  with 3 kids in the car...called customer services to be told that no one s answering there phones so can t tell me anything either wait for it or leave without it and wait 5 days for a refund!! Cheers tesco

Tesco Weybridge is a joke! Not open because the staff member due to open is  bad at getting up on time  this was said by another staff member waiting for the shop to open!!! Now stuck without a drink or food for my lunch and no chance to go out again! All because of a lazy member of staff !! Unacceptable!

My 5 year old is very disappointed with you tesco. Without warning you have stopped selling his favourite cereal and replaced it with a chocolate version. What good is that for a child that doesn t like chocolate. He loved your milk pillow cereal with the milk Centre and Iv been shopping to find you no longer sell this. How do I console s devastated 5 year old because you ve stopped (for no reason that I can see) doing his favourite cereal. We re not happy tesco one little bit!

Hey Tesco! whats the deal with the new carrier bags??? when the government introduced the 5 pence bag charge it was meant to be an initiative to get people to re-use their bags.  The ones i received last night were barely fit for one use let alone repeat usage.  I noticed the quality increase when the charge came in  however now they seem to be back to the ultra thin poor quality rubbish you used before.  Is this an attempt at cost cutting?  J

Having shopped at Tesco every day of my holiday in St Ives great food  great service - I was shocked today on taking mmy 10 receipts in to be told that I could only redeem points off 2 bills at a time even though I had been told by staff - don t worry you have forgotten your club card - just redeem points when got home! TESCOS actually trying to stop me put on my points - not good customer service
Is tesco closing down their beauty world departments

Just a little message seen as staff are so easily discipline but never praised enough  just doing a little shop with my  girlfriend and our two children at the Rotherham wath store and our youngest started a tantrum (as kids do when they don t get there own way) a very nice lady came over and kindly asked our child is she would like a apple or banana....instantly our child stopped crying as the lady gave her one. It might of only been a banana but it stopped her from crying the member of staff didn t need to do anything but she did I m sorry I didn t get your name but you know who you are thank you ever so much üëç

Went into your Corstorphine branch tonight looking for a kids cozy coupe. One of your managers took the last one off the shelf and put it behind the customer service desk for herself.   Why are staff aloud to hold items?   Not impressed Tesco!

So today this happened when I was due to collect my shopping from my local store.   I received a call at around 4 informing me we either needed to pick up our shopping (we had a 6-8 slot) before 6:30 or go via customer services and ask for a specific person  as there was no one available to work in the collection pod after 6:30.  My husband finished his shift at 7  so went to collect it  I d informed him of the phone call  so off he went to customer services.  He was then told to go to the pod......pointless phone call earlier then.   On arrival  he was given 3 bags of shopping that weren t ours  so he told the person there and they replied with  so where s yours then?!   They then had to root through several crates to find ours  which had been stickered up wrong.  My husband then came home  half an hour later than he should ve been  and left me to unpack it all....  ALL my fruit is missing.  The frozen stuff that had been labelled wrong was almost defrosted  the meat was in with some donuts (yum!)  and said donuts were so hot they d sweated off their icing.  My meat was warm  and I know its a warm day  but as warm as the bread was isn t acceptable-not sure if its even edible now.  I ve literally got less than half my shopping that I know is useable  because most of that is non perishable items  or toiletries.  Tomorrow my husband is off work  we had hoped to take our children for a day out  before they go back to school-but now I have to factor in a food shop we had intended to avoid by doing it online!!!!!!!  I sent the above to tesco on here. And at first they did the whole  we are truly sorry nonsense . After taking my details they told me they could reorder my missing items but it would obviously cost me  then that they d get someone to call me tomorrow to sort re-delivery if needed  even when I d said because it s literally everything fresh that s missing I need to get it asap in the morning - it s my kids fruit veg and lunch stuff for christ sake!  I got asked to send the list of missing and things with an issue which is LONG and once I d wasted my time sending that  I was then told to take my receipt into store to sort a refund for all things missing. As if that s going to work when the store have no idea I ve been told to do this.   So now I m without most of my shopping because of a basic staffing issue that could ve been avoided.   I ve spent all night trying to sort it and ended up out of pocket  no decent food in the house and now time taken out of the last day my kids have off with their daddy because we need to go shopping.   Thanks tesco! Never mind I shop once a week with you online and spend ¬£350 a month. Customer loyalty isn t in this shops vocabulary.
I have had to cancel my order for tomorrow because the servers have closed down early and I cannot amend my order. Absolute bloody shambles Tesco.

I feel I should let other shoppers know what I found out today. I always use scan and pack when I shop in tesco as I find it a lot quicker than checking out at a till point.  On Saturday we purchased a few items at the Tesco on the Yarmouth/Gorleston retail park. My husband went to a normal checkout to pay. After his receipt came out he then got 4 vouchers including ¬£9 of a ¬£60 shop. I was really surprised with this as I have not received any vouchers like these for months. I thought it was funny so when I went in today to do a ¬£85 shop using scan and pack I mentioned this to the assistant who confirmed what I thought and that when using this service you do not get any money off/points bonus vouchers.   This is disgusting and not fair  why should we be penalised for using a service that saves Tesco time and money but takes us longer to shop. In my eyes we are all customers and spending money so why not treat all the same. A very unhappy customer.

Hi  having used Tesco nappies for almost 4 years  I ve noticed a decline in quality as they are now disintegrating all over my daughter s bottom after a short period of time. Whilst I appreciate that the nappies seem to cost less now  this has coincided with this decline in quality. It now looks like I m left with a choice of this cheap option Vs the more expensive leading brand (when I think Tescos nappies were actually better!). My preference would be for a mid range option which now seems to be have been denied if I continue my online shop with tesco.com.
i d like tesco s customer service complaint department email but cannot find it on the webpage. could you be so kind and point it out to me please?
When do u going to put back cheeky bots nappies back thanks

Just received my online order  I ticked no substitutes but clearly you ignore that. I ordered 2 loafs of B Free dairy and gluten free bread but you sent me genius which is only gluten free not a great idea is it? I have sent it back but still .....

I bought a pair of Skullcandy headphones in May this year. They have stopped working. I can t find the receipt but I can print the bank transaction from my online banking as proof of purchase. I ve no idea if I used my clubcard or not when buying them. Do I need to contact the electrical helpline about them  or can the store deal with it?
I think it is terrible that tesco is now charging for click and collect from store for orders under ¬£30  absolutely disgusting!
Bought a box of your Tesco finest Belgian chocolates  there are 15 listed but only 14 in the box! Gutted.
Cheers Tesco you have gone and lost my kids  school uniform order and leaving me out of pocket every little helps #nothappy
WHY IS YOUR CHICKEN STILL BEING SOURCED FROM THAILAND??????? AND YES I AM SHOUTING!! YOU ARE A DISGRACE!!!!!

Dear Tesco   I am not normally one to write and complain  but recent events have compelled me to do otherwise.  I am referring to your own-brand washing up gloves  or as I prefer to call them  the slipperiest thing known to mankind. With this product you have turned a laborious daily chore into something more akin to wrestling an excitable snake covered in baby oil.   Now I am a fit 28 year old  without the least tremor in my hands  and yet I have just dropped and broken a glass (one of my favourite  as sods law would have it). I dread to think what kind of hell some of your less steady customers must go through.   I genuinely believe this is actually a dangerous product; I could have easily cut myself badly  and you should change suppliers or alter the design.  Tesco  you need to get a grip!   (Sorry  I couldn t resist the obvious pun)

We are going to serve a civil claim against Tesco  relating to a faulty Hudl 2 purchased in October last year. The store and helpline have refused to refund or exchange the item. Can someone provide the address to serve the summons please?
Absolutely useless Customer service...I have had a reply that directed me to the webpage  not really helpful...

hoping u may be able to help  i have gone online and changed address and am trying to order some vouchers on club card deals in the vein hope they may arrive before the end of the holidays  but i cant order as they are still saying they will send to my old address

Purchased a new Tesco Nokia 108 on the Tesco network on the 25.08.2016. I have not been able to use it as yet because of network problems. Caller can not be heard.......as off 18.58 on the 30.08.16.   5 days so far  ! some service !

Hi Tesco  Who labels your products online as you consistently appear to be mislabelling products on your website. Never mind in store. I know computing products can sometimes be tricky to understand but it doesn t take a rocket scientist to read from a spec sheet and input it on your website correctly.

Can anyone tell me why the pay at pump  declined  m cards saying to  use another form of payment   didnt pump out any petrol until id paid with someone elses card  didnt give me a receipt but has still put money on hold in my account?

That is disgusting you run a shop i sold be allowed to buy as many tuns as i need as long as i have the money for them. Wont bother using tour store üëéüëé

Went into your longton store today and was very pleased with how much more variety you have in your free from freezers now  my 2 year old daughter has enjoyed her very 1st taste of scampi  I bought her some onion rings too as shes always wanting to try them but hasn t been able to til half hour ago yep she enjoyed those as well with some chips  she then went on to have an ice lolly with icecream inside all bought from the free from sectionüòä.. now Mr tescos you just need to work on more variety of dairy free cheeses  and dairy free pizzas

Well Tesco. All I can say is thank you. I went into your chineham Basingstoke store today to sort my prescription for my glasses. It took me an hour of much swapping and changing to finally decide on what I wanted. I was being advised by the lovely ladies who work in the opticians department all of this time. They made me feel so relaxed about buying my first ever set of glasses. After much chatting and laughing with them I was ready to pay up and leave but before I could they came round the corner with a lovely bunch of flowers for my birthday tomorrow.  It s the little things in life that make life so much nicer. You have really made my day!!

Very very appalled by tesco Millbrook!  I m a single working mum of two so shopping is difficult anyway and i had a double pram  and a trolley.. tried pushing it through the store  WITH all your staff staring at me some even laughing at me! And when I got to the till  she put all my stuff at the end and left me to it.. and my 4 month old was screaming the whole time!  Instead of offering to help  I was made uncomfortable!  Never will be shopping there anymore!

Went to tesco today went to buy some pre packed bananas at 90p but just curiously thought I would weigh them to see what they were priced at and they were priced at 55p so have to say I put the pre packed back and bought my bananas singly have to say I find it a joke on how much u make on your pre packed bananas I won t be buying them that way again!!!
Rich at the checkout in your long eaton superstore is brill! #greatservice

Tesco staff were very well organised by putting up a sign at the front of the store to show the opening/closing/ times over the Bank Holiday for customers reference and convenience. If not then the information will be shown on the internet. HiT
Are you purposly against on line banking ?  Waiting for weeks now for a response !

2 1/2 weeks have passed since I had a fall in your Dundee shop due to plastic flower bags in isle  on way out of store to which health and safety was not adhered to as no record taken  of incident at time despite numerous messages through FB saying your accident team will be in touch nearly 3 weeks later I am still waiting !!! This is unbelievable that a simple phone call can take 3 weeks I have asked for head office number numerous times to which is said they don t give it out disgraceful service

today i had my tesco delivery whilst my children were out the front playing water fights   my 5 year old son wet jock the delivery driver   jock then swore at my 5 year old son telling him to f off   grabbed my sons water gun threw it on the floor and smashed it . not very good customer service on a hot summers day . physically grabbing a toy off a child and smashing it . my first post was then removed for swearing even though i was simply repeating their employees words .

Hey Tesco  you really should stop making your drivers work themselves to the bone.  I ask this because I was in my garden with my little boy who was playing  turned my back then turned back round only to see what must have been sweat running down the drivers face. You should be ashamed.  Oh but can you ask him if he s seen my sons water pistol anywhere when he visited  it appears to have gone missing.

Hi tesco  please could you recommend a water pistol that is strong and durable...I don t know lets say tough enough to stand up against a grown delivery driver with possible gulf war syndrome and random cinematic flash backs to his prisoner of war days! Is the super soaker the best option and does it come in any other colours rather than red (wouldn t want to antagonise anyone). That s great thanks! Oh p.s. Do you do click and collect?
Do you sell good quality water pistols that can t be broken by your delivery drivers when they re in a bad mood  thanks in advance

Hi Tesco. There seems to be a problem with your grocery app. Basket keeps popping up with an error. Will allow to add items but after a certain amount of time the basket error will appear and wipe out whatever was added

I brought a Star Wars  bag from your Midsomer Norton branch today. Got home to find the security tag still on it. Now I have to spend the rest of my afternoon on buses to get back there to sort it out. Not happy.

I would just like to thank the security staff at Hollington tesco for being so kind and helpful today. Having your handbag stolen is horrible but with my son giving a womans description and the security staff being on the ball the lady was found and so was my bag. Epipen was missing but that can be replaced. Thankyou very much.

has anyone else noticed the huge change in the tesco basics mature english cheddar. It is marked  as a strength 3 has always been a really nice  middle of the road mature cheddar. Now it is no better than the mild english cheddar with no bite or flavour and only comes in blocks as big as a house. I can only conclude that they ve changed suppliers or the current one is putting a different cheese in the packet

Hello I bought a dry wipe memo board with pens and eraser last week I stuck it to the wall and it fell off ..so I stuck it up again...it fell off again..it then stuck it to the fridge and again it fell off and exposed the cardboard interior and the razor sharp edges of the metal board itself. Hello   We ve just been to your store on Manchester road in Warrington. Whilst shopping my daughter needed the toilet so rather than dump our shopping my wife asked Jack if there were any toilets.   He was on the till and the only member of staff in the actual shop  he took my wife and daughter to the toilets where there was 2 other members of staff talking and then hurried back to the till.  When my wife and daughter had finished they came back out to find poor jack being shouted at!  1) by allowing them to use the toilet it meant we continued with our purchases and didn t leave the store.  2) if they were shouting at him for leaving my wife alone why didn t one of them go on the till whilst he waited  or at least offer to wait in the back for my wife.  3) there is no way he should have been in trouble  but even if he was he shouldn t have been told off on the shop floor in front of customers!  Once we had finished our shopping we joined the queue to pay  again poor jack was on his own on the till and quite a queue was building  he rang the bell for assistance on 3 separate occasions before anyone came to help him and open another till.  I genuinely think that Jack should receive recognition for the service he provided today  I however feel that his manager and co worker need to be given a serious chat around customer service and teamwork!

I would like to point out to you something I witnessed in you store Vevay rd Bray  today at around 5.40 pm.  While shopping in this store  I was walking behind a tesco security man as he paused briefly and turned into the aisle I was going.  He approached a very young boy  who was down on his knees looking through a box of mini puzzles that cost 1 euro.  Clearly due to the selection of mini puzzles in this box  this young child was taking them out to have a look  and placing them beside the box on the shelf  when the security man asked him what was he doing  the child say he was looking  the security man in my strongest opinion  proceeded to verbally scold the child by telling him not to take them out. I was surprised by this reaction to the child by this security man  so I approached him to say  the child is allowed to look  and he cannot tell the child not to look  the security man took offence in my opinion  to me speaking to him  he told me to go about my business  to which I repeated this is not his job to tell customers they cannot look  again he told me to go about my business  and not to tell him his job  and to get out  which came as a shock  I told him I would not leave  and again that he is security and cannot tell a custom not to look  we are all intitled to look. I m sure this can be seen on your shop recording. I don t think Tesco should allow or permit their security to approach any child that was clearly doing nothing wrong. Itade my stomach turn tp see an adult clearly over step their mark  especially when it concerns a minor. I would like you thoughts and views on this. I hope you take my concerns on board and look into the matter. Kind regards.

Well  after yesterday we will no longer be spending ¬£400 per month at Tesco Lanark after 2 years of shopping with them! We purchased a DVD (The Wave) in Carluke and note...Title in English as with the rest of the cover. We returned home and found that the security tag had not been removed at Tesco and realising the security alarm did not go off. We thought oh well (we have the receipt) We then managed to open the security tab and proceeded to play the DVD. We were shocked to find the DVD was in Norwegian and immediately phoned Tesco Carluke and as we live in Lanark  they advised that if the Tesco in Lanark is a superstore like theirs  we would not have a problem in explaining what the problem was  after all  we noticed in VERY small pring on the back  it did mention  with english sub-titles  but the whole outer casing was in English! We did as suggested go to the Lanark Tesco and explained what had transpired  The security Tab  the language issue etc and was met with  sorry  but regulations state we do not accept a DVD if returned and no refund is possible   this after we said we would choose another DVD of the same value or more! Well  as mentioned  we will no longer be spending ¬£400 pm at Tesco for our shopping and quite honestly  for a huge company to decline a ¬£7.00 DVD refund or swop for another DVD is disgusting. Oh well Tesco  you ve lost yet another valued customer....Lidl and Morrisons here we come!

I bought a  ¬£70 8ft plum trampoline end of June   within not even a week the pole that goes round the top of netting snapt  I rang tesco back up and they told me they would send me a new pole out  the delivery came and he left me with a brand new trampoline to which I didn t need and just pulled away. I got the new pole put in and that one snapt straight away also  rang tesco to say I wanted my money back so the lady said to take the trampoline down and ring them back when it s down  to which I did for a man to say I had to re box the full trampoline or they wouldn t take it and I d only get 10 pound back and he didn t know why the lady didn t tell me that  so I manged to get some boxes and box it all up. Rang tesco up on Friday 20th August for a collection day  I said I couldn t do Monday so he said Tuesday I said yeah that s fine. Gets home Monday to a card to say they had been  so I rang back up and he didn t know why they came out and offered Tuesday for them to come I said yes  a man turns up on the morning with a car full of stuff I said I have 5 large boxes (2 trampoline s) he said oh ill have to get a van here  so I sat in till 7pm and noone came in a van  rings tesco back up and he said sorry how about tomorrow (wedesnday) I said yes  so I sat again all day to noone coming to collect. Yet again rings then back just after 7pm and he gave me the number for Yodel  I rang them (automated system) on thursday morning and got today Saturday for collection to come home Thursday night to a card that they had been for trampoline s  (don t know why because they said Saturday) I have now been sat waiting since 7am for someone to collect as they said today  I can t ring them as like I said it s automated system and tesco weren t much help  if they don t turn up this will be three days I ve sat and waited for them. I have to ring tesco if they don t come and they will investigate it and ring someone within there department as they can t do that now because they could turn up  this is absolute joke  ease I ve already waited in two day s! My poor daughter only got to play on it for one day and that was June   it s now nearly end of august and it s not like it s a daft amount of money it s ¬£70.... I will never order anything from tesco direct again because this has been a right carry on

Afternoon.   Just wondered if you guys could enlighten me as to why your policy when using club card vouchers online differs drastically to in store transactions? Today my wife had ordered a shop  and had delightfully told me that using our club card vouchers had managed to get ¬£37.36 of shopping for the amazing low price of 86p. (Just to save you time on your calculator  that s ¬£36.50 of vouchers!) Now I can imagine like myself  you re thinking  that s a pretty sweet deal! Unfortunately it was too good to last! The wife received a phone call from you  saying that our card had been declined  which was odd because we had just moved ¬£30 into the account yesterday to cover petrol and shopping! Upon calling customer services she was told she had to pay ¬£33 for the shopping! (Literally no idea where this number was pulled from) When she said it was meant to be 86p  the customer service team decided to play what can only be described as  guess the number   and proceeded to change the amount owed 3 different times before settling back around the ¬£33 mark.  So what happened to the vouchers I hear you cry? Well apparently your policy is to take full payment before refunding the vouchers at a later date. (Which to clarify isn t explained anywhere on the confirmation email  not even in really tiny writing!) So here s the thing  why would you take the full amount to refund it back? If I went to a store and used my vouchers at the till  and then was told I d have to pay the full amount and wait on the refund  well  I don t think anyone would be happy with that!  So why the difference? Why haven t you displayed this policy anywhere on the confirmation email?  This is now the second time my family have had to drive the 15 miles to the nearest Tesco just because your online service is appalling. Just check mumsnet  you will see we re not the only ones Sort it out

So I went into my local tesco extra yesterday to finally buy my son s school uniform. Plenty of time to get it with still just under a couple of weeks to go before he starts back. Could you possibly tell me who s idea is it to have a money off voucher for school valid until the 14th August? When clearly most schools go back in September and with my case cannot purchase uniform until the end of August as I have a child who s birthday is at the beginning. No sorry from the advisor  just took the voucher and threw it away when he could clearly see I was quite annoyed with the situation. Yes it s only ¬£3  but that could be a loaf of bread and 4 pint of milk to someone that needed it from their change of buying the uniform. This is a rookie mistake in my opinion and feel that this needs to be revised for next year. Thank you.

So embarrassed was in kirkintilloch shop on thursday picked my shopping went to quick check out put through my ¬£24 odds shopping done a contactless payment which was fine ....my wee one put her barbie on the scales after i paid so the baggage alert came up so picked up shopping and started to leave the store.....next thing the shop assistant comes running after me shouting in front of everyone  excuse me your card declined can you come back  well i went a funny red colour the shop was busy everyone looking at me....so goes back to the quick check out only for her to say oh sorry it did go through & heres your receipt.....i left quickly.....i shop here all the time but dont think i will be back so embarrassed.

DO NOT WASTE MONEY GO TO SPECSAVERS Ok so after waiting almost 6 weeks I ve had enough. I paid ¬£197 for two pairs of glasses they arrived to start with fairly quickly. I advised them three times (by going into store and calling the main head office) that I couldn t see. Finally I am told by the head office just pop back to the store they ll retest you yeah right!  No I had to come back a few days later after a major operation I did not need to be making my fourth trip to the optician. But I did to find out that the optician had written the axis as 15 instead of 115 I was offered a bunch of flowers for my trouble at the time I just wanted my glasses so I said no please just get my glasses sorted. Now I have made several calls to the rubbish liars at customer services head office as in the mean time I ve had to love house but my glasses have to go to the original store first.  20 days later my clear pair arrive at Northampton I m called as they need to send them to Ely. They get to Ely three days later to find out that the sun glasses (bearing in mind the hot weather is almost over now) haven t been made yet!!! So I call customer rubbish sorry services again at head office no they haven t been made no due date I ll get a regional manager to call you here I am 5 days later no call!!! Ha ha ha then I m asked to do a customer satisfaction questionnaire are you kidding me!!! Yes in still 26 days later have no second pair no idea when they will arrive and no customer service at all. The clear pair are uncomfortable and not worth the money  My advice better service and glasses at Specsavers don t even bother with Tescos!!! I played nice till now and now I ve had enough please feel free to share my experience as I would hate for other people to suffer such a poor service.

Tonight we received an amazing food donation from Tesco Extra StretfordüòÄüòÄ  The team from the store got in touch to ask if we could use some non perishable food items. But what we didn t realise was how much üòÅüòÅ  Sam and Jay   part of our team of volunteers   went to collect the donation. The donation was massive !!  Tins of food  biscuits  drinks  sauces  pasta  cake mixes  tuna  pickles  toiletries ....... You name it   it was there!!  We have shared this massive donation with Mad Dogs Street Project and took 3 full car loads with another trip tomorrow .  This could not of come at a better time for us. The food bank was in need of replenishment and Christmas is coming . This will make such a difference to a lot of people over the next few months.  Connections with businesses like Tesco are invaluable for charities and organisations like Coffee4craig and Mad Dogs.  Thank you so much Alex and Simon for helping tonight and thank you so much Tesco Extra Stretford

Dear Mr/Mrs Tesco  I wanted to congratulate you on your  Finest  meal deals for ¬£10 - a figure in the world we live in (or cash strapped Britain as those blokes in the city call it) deemed acceptable for a takeaway and even better value if you re getting a main  side  dessert and pack of those coke bottles.... tastes so much better in a glass bottle and I just don t know why  the same as a plastic chip fork over a wooden one (boke the dryness on my tongue). Tonight Denise and I mixed it up a bit and had your carbonara chicken for the first time. As someone who hates mushrooms (they fill you up too much  once you eat them there s naw mush-room for anything else) and is always wary of supermarket chicken after the toenail dilemma of  99 I can honestly say it was a taste sensation. We washed it down with your  chunky chips  better know as fat boys that take double the time to cook and they re still rock solid and a bottle (glass) of coke..... purely belter!! I then had the Amazonian Cheesecake which was superb  I got a slight tingle when I swallowed and swear I heard a parrot noise after every bite.... Aware Morrisons are tough competition as their cooked brekkies make yours look like a home-ec class gone wrong and asda with their affordable alcohol and fresh bakery (rolls are all warm and cuddly) so you must be finding it tough. Dine for a ten spot works and we will be back  next time try and make sure you ve stock of the flatbread and the creature packing the shelves doesn t abuse me for taking the chunky chips not in the deal instead of taking the chunky chips in the deal when the only difference is the colour of the text on your below par packaging and an excuse for death breath to verbally abuse me for apparently being colour blind. This is a step-up from the old days when you were used for buying spice girls singles and grapefruit and the only way is up...... Yours faithfully  Kennie

Hello    I am sure this post will have me nominated most tedious man in Britain  but I was in your store (Edinburgh  Hermiston Gait) earlier today buying a few things  and I was really annoyed by your fruit section.  You are Britain s top retailer and your values suggest you are  Making a positive contribution to the communities where we operate . I think in the UK s uncertain economic climate it s good to source produce locally where possible  and in terms of the literal climate it s good to purchase items that haven t had to be freighted across the globe  also where possible.  So  when in the UK in the UK s biggest retailer  who sell 77% of their products in the UK  looking at apples and pears  (something the UK produces hundreds of thousands of tonnes of every year)  sitting under a sign that proudly boasts  UK apples and pears are best now   I was pretty annoyed to see that not one single variety of pear and not one single variety of apple was from the UK.  There was Gala  Braeburn  Jazz  Granny Smith  Pink Lady  Golden Delicious  Bramley  Kazi... maybe even more... a lot of stock  a lot of varieties  but not one was a British apple or a British pear.  The majority were from New Zealand  South Africa  Italy  and even Chile  Why?   The signage is misleading and your brand values don t stack up to what s getting put on the shelves in this regard.  Where s all the British fruit and why aren t you selling it?

My husband and I went to tesco in elgin Saturday and  as we had the dogs with us  I chose to park in the only shady place  behind the cash machine.  There was a security guard smoking there but as it was warm I felt that my need for the shade was greater than his.  As the space was a little small my husband decided to get out of the car before I reversed in. He happened to look at the tyres as I was reversing and when I was getting out he said   omg you have to come and look at this .  I was absolutely horrified when I saw the split in the wall of the tyre; partly because it had had a health check at the dealership a couple of weeks earlier and partly because I had checked them myself earlier in the week.  So we popped into the shop for the few bits and pieces we needed and then went home very carefully because I was so concerned about the tyre.  We would have gone to the tyre man then but he is only open on Saturday mornings so we planned to take it in first thing on Monday.  When I got home I started making lunch only to be called by my husband as two police officers had appeared and were looking at my car. I went straight out to them and told them that we had just become aware of the issue and had already made plans to deal with it on Monday.  I explained about the health check and the check I had performed earlier in the week and they were satisfied I was being open and honest and went on their way.  It was clear from what they said that the security guard had phoned them.  I accept that I was responsible for driving the car when I shouldn t have but our shock and horror must have been obvious to the guard who had clearly overheard our conversation.  I would also like everyone who reads this to consider how often they check their own tyres.  Tesco told my husband  when he went in to ask if it was their policy to check the roadworthiness of all the vehicles on their car park  that the guard had been acting because of duty of care.  I think that the guard at the very least showed poor judgment in his actions and I wonder how he behaves to people who might genuinely make a mistake with their shopping.  And I also wonder why  if they are so concerned about duty of care  tesco allow their staff to pollute the car park by smoking.  If I leave my dogs in the car when it s a bit warm I leave the windows down and have to put up with the stench of cigarettes in my car on my return.  After this experience with them  I will certainly think twice before shopping at any tesco again.

Dear Tesco  my husband and I tonight were at the store in Colinton  Edinburgh  and we saw loaves and loaves of bread being bagged  not for human consumption  so not for charities. We asked the people in charge and they explained us that this is your policy: you don t reduce some items  you just put them in a bin and give them to farms...would t be better to reduce them and try to sell them to the community? And shouldn t you consider to bake less and cut less bread in order to prevent waste? Are fighting or not this absurd waste? We look forward to hearing from you soon. #wastenot !

I wish to inform you that I will no longer be shopping in any of your stores and would urge others to do the same. Your decision to remove a saltire from produce made or grown in Scotland is disgusting. It shows a lack of respect for the individual nations within our union. It is my opinion that as one of our leading supermarket chains you are in an ideal position to be aware of all the differences between our four member nations. While it is important to remember we are a union  it is also important to give credit where it is due.   Allowing customers to bully you into removing our flag shows you are more concerned with profits than your customers.   I sincerely hope that you see common sense and become more sensitive to the people who buy your products.

Dear Tesco  Again  I find myself having to write/contact you regarding a substitution in my shopping this morning. In my original order I ordered 400g of loose cooked counter ham  as I am having friends and their children over today and am providing a delicious lunch of ham sandwiches  crisps and other party/picnic type foods!  Imagine my brief disappointment when the delivery driver informs me that this item  was the one that was substituted. When we both looked though we noted that it had been replaced for finest  loose  cooked ham  so to us both that looked an acceptable substitute.  After the driver left and shopping was being put away I noticed that the said ham was in fact in a plastic package  not loose as said on receipt and there is only 125g costing ¬£2.50! Now    as a mother of 18 yrs I am very good at making food  spread out  in the occasion of unexpected people arriving for dinner  but I feel that even in the style of Jesus during the feeding of the 5000  I would struggle to make 125g of ham stretch to the equivalence of 400g - perhaps I could put a small piece in the corner of each sandwich so it  looks  as though it s packed with delicious ham? I telephoned customer services and I was offered a refund of my ¬£2.50  for which I am grateful  but this does now mean that I have to get my children ready and go out and drive to my local  nearest (competitor) supermarket and purchase more sliced delicatessen products.  This one item seems to be an issue for the pickers at your Stafford store as it is always the one I have problems with - maybe they have had a bad experience with Teddy Bears and now have an aversion to  picnic  style food  I don t know? Still  I suppose the product received today was better than the day I received raw chicken breast instead of cooked sliced chicken - DIY deli chicken perhaps  could be your next marketing drive(?).  Now I must dash as the good people at JS Sainsbury s are waiting for me with their sharpened meat slicer and their plastic gloves. I look forward to hearing from you in due course. Michelle

What is the point of having CCTV if you do not bloody record it!!! I have found out the most of the cameras on the bletchley extra store are not recorded because your staff told me. So disappointed after the nice comments i put on my post yesterday about the incident.

For the last week the Manager and  managers  of my local Tesco have been painting the facade of the store. Clearly they are not professional painters as professional painters are men who have learnt their trade. Though I am sure they are doing their best a lot of paint is going on the floor which doesn t look good. Also  curiously  they are painting perfectly good stainless steel bollards with metallic  paint. ( a bizarre thing to do to stainless steel) Now I realise Tesco s profits are in the doldrums  but doesn t using untrained people to do what should be done by a tradesman portray a rather strange amateurish image to customers? I especially liked the manager who had taped Tesco carrier bags over his shoes to protect them from rogue paint very funny. Of course the Store will remain anonymous.

Hello tesco :)  Just went into my local metro  picked up my shopping and realised that I had forgotten one of the myriad of  bags for life  that I m collecting. Imagine my horror  when I was told that you don t do a bag for life any more  once the dizziness had passed  I asked why - was told it s a euro thing or too many people were exchanging them.  I don t believe it s a new edict from Brussels as punishment for us voting to leave the EU  I m sure my bag for life mountain could support the whole country for a few years. Today something happened which every mum dreads: we had no food in so we had to go food shopping. I delayed by taking a walk with my small person  we visited the park and went to a baby group. However  I could delay no longer. The reality of the one slice of bread and no milk was real. We trudged round Tesco  aforementioned small person strapped into the child seat of the trolley. All was fine... Until we got to Aisle 18. A melt down was brewing. The child wanted out. Desperate to avoid what every parent fears the most - a super market tantrum - I dutifully lifted Small from the trolley. Let me tell you that lugging your 11 month old  who weighs over 30lb  whilst tying to steer a trolley is no mean feat. I kept trying to put him back in the trolley  but he was having none of it. With a shopping list as long as my arm  I plodded on. I had a sweat on at this point  ready to abandon the trolley. Just how essential is toilet roll anyway?   That is until we reached what I can only describe as a beacon of light: a tray of fruit with the heading  Free Fruit For Children - Help Yourself!  Above it. Said child loves fruit  as in really really loves fruit. Thanks to the free satsuma  I managed to get my small person into the trolley seat and complete my shop with no further meltdowns.   Now  if only you could provide a shot of whiskey for the parents as well as fruit for the children  I would really enjoy the weekly shop!

So we re now told the saltire as an indication of country of origin has been removed from Scottish sourced fruit because of complaints from English consumers. Tescos remedy for this seems to be to pander to their whims and instead impose a Union flag on all of us.   The saltire not only serves to instantly give an instant visual indication of origin  but also a brand image of quality assurance along the lines of Scotch Whisky  Scotch Beef  Scottish Salmon etc...    For Tesco to ditch this in favour of imposing the Union flag on us makes a total mockery of claimed pride in Scottish produce.  Why not add a St Georges cross to English based produce to satisfy their sudden new found pride. I wouldn t find that in sny way offensive at all. The packaging mechanism clearly exists already.   No matter  in response to this ill thought out decision  I ve made mine  and my fruit and veg will now be sourced from outlets that aren t scared to promote the saltire flag such as Morrisons  Aldi  Lidl  etc...
I have been a Tesco shopper for many years but no more. Removing the Saltire from Scottish goods is the final straw. I hope the management is proud.

For quite a while now  on a fortnightly basis  I would to pick stuff up from Tesco  Hart Place  Bicester  Oxfordshire  that I had difficulty getting at the big Tesco. Through no fault of the staff there  this arrangement stopped and one of the staff  Kerry  said she would call me if they were able to start it up again. When you take car insurance out through TESCO and pay yearly... Someone goes into the back of you whilst your sat at a red traffic light... Your car gets smashed and taken in for repairs... TESCO send your details to ENTERPRISE to get a hire car... You rent a car from enterprise as they instruct you details have been passed from your insurance company and they will claim the fee s back from the 3rd party as you were not in fault... 8 months later    MTA SOLICITORS send you a letter to advise you have to go to court and they have a barrister to represent you  (who you have not Instructed to) due to claiming for a courtesy car???? REALLY? Is this real? Are people able to do this??? I would never of had a courtesy car IF my details were not passed my MY insurance company to ENTERPRISE. The courtesy car was offered  i work  I have a child and I live in the sticks!! If I didn t need a car i wouldn t have a car in the first place. Does anyone no where I stand with this headache/ or who I can report this to?? MTA solicitors call me all the time asking all sorts of questions   asking for my personal financial details including bank statements   sending letters to me causing unnecessary stress. I assumed this would be part of having insurance when someone crashes into you/careless drivers on the road? #tescoinsurethebox #enterprise #MTAsolicitors

Dear Tesco   I just wanted to get in touch to make you aware of some fantastic members of staff you have at Tesco Trent Vale/Stoke. Today I went shopping in this store with my 3 year old daughter. On the way round my daughter managed to lose her little mouse teddy from the story Gruffalo named  Mousey .   On asking your staff if anyone had handed him in  they contacted customer services  but no one had. A staff member Becky & one of the security staff began a sweep of all store aisles to look for Mousey  but we couldn t find him.   Another member of staff mentioned they had seen a little boy with his dad or grandad go through the checkouts not so long ago with  Mousey . My little girl was terribly upset as she takes Mousey to bed at night with her.   Becky showed great empathy & compassion & comforted my little girl by fetching her something else to play with & cuddle. This cheered my little girl up no end.   In a world so full of negativity & criticism  I thought it only right to let you know about this brilliant piece of customer service  & I hope Becky will get some sort of recognition for her hard work.  Kindest regards  Kelly

Thank you very much big man.

I just wanted to say a massive thank you to your store in Cullompton I had phoned earlier this morning to see if they had a wheelchair I could borrow whilst in store  my daughter broke her leg on Sunday and can t get around very easily. I was advised yes there was a wheelchair I could borrow. We made are way to the store got the wheelchair an did our shopping. We then headed to the checkouts to pay  my daughter was becoming more and more distressed  we were met at the checkout by a lovely lady Lisa (she advised she was normally on the customer service desk) she talked to my daughter the whole time whilst scanning our items. We then had finished our purchases and Lisa gave our daughter a bar of chocolate an came out an gave her a big hug. By the time we left the store we had a happy 7 year old an a less frazzled mummy. So a massive thank u to Lisa she is a credit to the Cullompton team xxx
So right now I m behind the Tesco Pride van and seriously having fun. Your staff have been enthusiastic for the entire march and the atmosphere is amazing. Well done!

All too often we see complaints and gripes on here about Tescos stores  but I need to lavish praise on an employee at the 24hr Tesco Westwood store in Scarborough.  Employee of the year award should go to JO RICHARDSON who was helpful above and beyond the call of duty.  My husband and I were in the Westwood store having just had an issue at a local guest house. I was quite upset; Jo saw this and asked if everything was okay. My husband explained our dilemma and  Super Jo  went into superior customer service mode!  She went out of her way to contact someone she knew (a colleague called Andy) to check on alternative accommodation; she then contacted the landlady of that guest house & arranged a room for us.  Due to Jo s assistance our holiday ended happily; if it hadn t have been for her help  our holiday would have been ruined.   Thank you Jo and thank you Tesco - as your motto says  Every little helps . Employees like Jo really are a credit to your company.

I have been in email communications with your Customer Services team for the past week regarding your proud press announcement to start selling Carolina Reaper Chillies.  It seems as though they are as attainable as a unicorn steak and not only that  your customer services team in fact know nothing about them.  This issue first arose after making a special effort to try and locate them in the London stores listed as stockists on your website.  None of the stores had them in stock which is why I contacted Customer Services.  The first person told me to check in the stores listed on your website (which was a point I had made clear in my first email) and then told me that there are supplier issues and they don t know when they ll be back in stock after telling me they are not in stock.  Another person apologised for the  rigmarole  and said that the confusion has arisen from the fact that Carolina Chillies go by another name and that they are the Komodo Dragon chillies and widely available.  I was stunned  especially given that the recent press release not only includes a graphic showing that Carolina is hotter than Komodo but that you started selling Komodo chillies in 2015 and that of course they are two entirely different chillies - I am still waiting for a response from Customer Services regarding this.  Your press announcement remains online as do the fanciful stockists and I really would like to know if  when and where in the country they will be available?

Good Afternoon Tesco   We bought a Hudl1 from your Stockport Store approximately 2yrs ago as a present for our son.  At the time of buying the tablet we were torn between the Hudl   a Kindle  and another tablet (which I think was an Asus one).  We wanted to go away and check on reviews but were pressured into making a decision and took the advice of the store assistant and opted for the Hudl as we were assured our son would get at least 5 years out of it.  To protect it we also bought the Hudl specific case.   Our son rarely uses his tablet   but does play occasional games and research for his homework.  Unfortunately last week he went to switch it on and there was a problem with the screen.  I contacted Customer Service and this was looked into.  I was advised there was a known problem and the Hudl is no longer available   and repairs are no longer being offered and I had to wait on a call back to let me know what you will be offering.  I received contact today offering ¬£35 towards a replacement.  I queried this as although the tablet is outside of its manufacturers warranty   the advice we were given upon buying the Hudl led us to believe that it was the better option instead of the Kindle   or an Asus tablet that was a similar price.  I was told Tesco don t stock Tablets at ¬£35.00 and there is nothing else that can be done as it us a set figure you can offer.   I have looked online and information regarding the Sale Of Goods Act is quite vague but I feel the offer is derisory considering we must have spent over ¬£120 on a gift that is useless after less than half of the time it was meant to last for.  Even the protective case we paid around ¬£20 for is worthless.  We allow our son an hour a night on his tablet if he has been good during the day and he now feels he is being punished and is having  the worst school holidays ever . He is only 7 so hopefully the suffering will soon ease.   Is there really nothing further that can be done regarding this?  Any further help would be greatly appreciated.   Kind Regards

I ve never been to a Tesco. I figure it s a grocery store. I m from the south and we don t have Tesco where I m from.  But  I d like to remind everyone that it doesn t matter where you buy your fruits and veggies at  live--and dead--bugs in them is a very common occurrence! Whether it s a Stop-N-Shop in the New England region  Food Lion along the South East  Wal-Mart  Kroger  Farmers Markets in the deep South or some other store anywhere in the country--and out--bugs are a risk you take when buying fruits and vegetables!   This is WHY you re supposed to thoroughly wash your fruits and vegetables! To get them off.  So  stop whining about living and dead bugs on your fresh produce  suck it up  say  oh well!  And wash it off! It s not like it s a canned or frozen product that you ve opened and discovered a bug or--shiver--some other critter (or even a severed digit!) in!

Firstly I would like to say a big thank you for providing trolleys with seats adapted for people with disabilities. My  nearly 3 year old son sat it in for the first time today and I can t tell you how much more relaxing my shopping trip was knowing that he couldn t inadvertently injure himself by head butting the handle bar while I was putting something in the trolley.   This positive experience however was dampened by a security guard with little to no a)customer service skills and b) common sense. When leaving the store we unavoidably set off the security alarm (I fully understand why these valuable trolleys are tagged!) We were swiftly met by the guard who stated that under no circumstances could I leave the store with  that  trolley. Well Mr Security guard  how on earth do you expect me to carry my disabled son and my heavy shopping to the car. His response was a shrug. I then explained that the whole point of an adapted trolley was to make life easier and so by not being allowed to step out of the store with it simply defeated the object of having one in the first place!! Thankfully a lady behind the customer service desk told the security guard that  of course the lady can take the trolley to her car!    I believe that some of your staff desperately require some disability awareness training!

I visited Tesco at Tower park yesterday for the first time with my newborn baby who was nicely tucked up in his cosy carseat  sound asleep. I remembered from a few years ago with my older son that there were trollies that you could put your own baby carseat on  so i took him out of the car still in his carseat and struggled over with my large changing bag and shopping bags in tow to the trolly area to grab one to save waking him up. When i got to the trollies i couldnt find any  so asked a member of staff for help. I was unhelpfully told there should of been some there but as there werent any trolly staff in at that particular time they couldnt help me. Concequently i ended up struggling back to the car to take my baby out of his carseat (and wake him up) to put him in a trolly with a dirty baby seat on it  which was miles too big and completely unsuitable for a newborn. Of course the trolly i happened to chose had rickety wheels too so not only was his head wobbling around unsupported  but was banging on the side of the seat our entire visit! This was obviously very uncomfortable for him as he screamed the whole way around the shop! If one of the carseat trollies was available we would of had a problem & stress free experience  instead it was very stressful and not one i care to repeat again. Needless to say until this problem has been resolved i wont be visiting Tesco again. I shall be shopping at one of your competitors stores who value their customers with newborn babies.

Hello. I am a vegetarian who is considering going vegan. I am here on behalf of myself  anyone else in this country who is looking at going vegan and the current vegans in this country. I see that you already label your vegetarian products as  Suitable for vegetarians  - thanks.  However  there is a growing number of vegans in this country. Many people go vegan for animal rights/welfare  health  environmental  personal  perhaps religious and/or other reasons. Because of all these combined  there are about half a million vegans in this country  along with other people who reduce their intake of meat  dairy  eggs and/or other animal products.  Labelling vegan products as vegans would make things easier for all of these people  especially those who have a limited amount of time and/or are under pressure from parents and/or guardians. Because of this  I would like to politely ask that you label  all of your products that are vegan as vegan.   Thank you.

Good Morning  It is with regret that I am forced to complain with regards to my visit to your store at Tesco on Sunday 14th August.  I visited the store shortly before 12 pm with my 15-year-old step son to purchase myself one bottle of beer. After a short period of deliberation  I opted for a bottle of Franziskaner Hefe Weissbier but whilst attempting to pay for the item  the cashier informed me that he would need to see Identification for both myself and my step son.  I am 34 and always carry my driving license so showing identification for myself is not a problem. However  my step son does not have identification to show that he is 18 as he is only 15  and given that the single bottle of beer I was attempting to purchase was for myself I would have anticipated that his age was irrelevant.  I asked to speak to a Team Leader  who attempted to explain that it was company policy. I asked for clarity as to the age he would be regarded as young enough to not have to show ID  for example if he had been 13 instead of 15 would the same situation arise. Understandably  neither member of staff could answer this question given the policy there were following was clearly not in place for these circumstances.  I had anticipated that common sense would perhaps prevail however it seemingly became a situation of ‚Äúcomputer says no‚Äù  and both the cashier and Team Leader explained that in order for a 34-year-old with sufficient ID to purchase alcohol  a 15-year-old who was not attempting to purchase alcohol would need to prove that they were older than they were.  This is not the first time I have attempted to purchase alcohol in the presence of my step son  however it was the first time I was refused at point of sale. Whilst I fully appreciate the importance of ensuring age regulated purchases are carefully monitored  I would like to think that Tesco would agree that it is not acceptable for parents to leave their dependants outside a store every time they attempt to such a product.  I would very much appreciate your feedback on this matter.  Neil Bontoft

This afternoon my 3 year old son and I visited the Tesco on Bridge Road in Rainham.  When we got to the check out he began to scream... he has learning difficulties and a severe speech delay  so as much as I asked what was wrong and gave him options I was unable to figure out what was wrong with him.  As you can imagine it s frustrating for both of us and makes me anxious of what people s opinions of us are when he is screaming and I m unable to make him stop.  I finished loading my shopping and the cashier asked me what he wanted. I explained I didnt know. She asked if he wanted to help. I asked him if he wanted to pack the shopping and gave him the bag  the lady scanned the first item and passed it to him as I held the bag open. He then stopped crying!!!  She did this with a few items then I said to her it would take all afternoon to let him do it all and laughed (secretly worrying what his reaction would be when I took over packing).  She went on to tell me not to worry how long it took and to let him do it!! I was shocked!! With this my little boy was happy and the cashier and I were able to have a little chat while he happily packed the shopping.  So Maureen on checkout 17 just before 4pm.. thank you! (I am told her surname is Anderson)  You not only helped me calm my little boy  but you helped me have confidence that not everyone is of the opinion that a screaming child is a naughty one!  You gave a child the time he needed to make his Tesco experience a great one. Something so seemingly small can mean so much to some people ‚ù§

I phoned tesco straight away who said they will exchange the out of date pk  and apologised. I told them I wasn t happy because I d have to make a special journey back (I live about 2 to 3 miles away)  couldn t go on Monday so went today. The duty manager did exchange them but I wasn t happy because 1)he didn t seem to concerned  even though they were over 2 wks out of date  2)all he said was I was told by a member of staff you were coming into exchange them because they were out of date  he didn t apologise just said I can t believe it  they must have been right at the back  3)I would have thought he d offered me something in the way of compensation  expecially when I pointed out that the store could have been in serious trouble had I have reported it to health and safety or head office. My grandson is 5 yrs old and the grandaughter is almost a yr old  if my daughter hadn t have realised they were out of date I would have given them  I dread to think how ill they would have been! Dear Mr Lewis I am one of more than 500 000 vegans living in the UK. As such  I am glad to see that Tesco is stocking an ever-wider range of specialist vegan products  and labelling them for easy identification. Having access to a range of clearly marked vegan products in supermarkets makes life much easier for me and other vegans. However  I notice that you have many more own-brand goods that appear to contain no animal products and yet are not labelled as being suitable for vegans. This inconsistent approach forces me to laboriously check every ingredient in all of your unlabelled products to see which ones are suitable for me. Using the list of vegan products on your website is also impractical because  at 44-pages long  it is much too large to carry with me and it takes too long to find the right item. I strongly urge you to print the Tesco ‚Äòvegetarian & vegan‚Äô logo on the packaging of ALL of your animal-free and cruelty-free products to avoid confusion and make shopping in your stores easier and more appealing for vegan customers. Kind regards

Hey Tesco   I am one of more than 500 000 Vegans living in the UK. As such  I am glad to see that Tesco is stocking an ever-wider range of specialist vegan products  and labelling them for easy identification. Having access to a range of clearly marked Vegan products in supermarkets makes life much easier for me and other Vegans.  However  I notice that you have many more own-brand goods that appear to contain no animal products and yet are not labelled as being suitable for Vegans. This inconsistent approach forces me to laboriously check every ingredient in all of your unlabelled products to see which ones are suitable for me. Using the list of Vegan products on your website is also impractical because  at 44-pages long  it is much too large to carry with me and it takes too long to find the right item.  I strongly urge you to print the Tesco ‚ÄòVegetarian & Vegan‚Äô logo on the packaging of ALL of your Animal-free and cruelty-free products to avoid confusion and make shopping in your stores easier and more appealing for Vegan customers.

Hi Tesco   Sunday morning I was due to pick up a click and collect order from your Tesco extra Maldon store in fullbridge between 10 and 12! As always I needed to pick a few bits up in store before collecting my order. On coming back to my car I had a flat tyre! (A very flat tyre) whilst waiting for the AA I walked over to the click and collect and asked the lady if it was possible for me to walk my shopping over to my car when they were a little less busy (they had a few cars queueing) she said this was fine and to Coke back when I was ready!   I was with my mum who waited by my car whilst I walked to the local tyre shop  when I returned to my surprise the lady had found my car and brought my shopping over and helped my mum put my shopping in my car! This was a lovely thing to do and not something that a lot of people would do! I didn t catch the ladies name but I would like to say thank you to her!  In the same trip when the gentleman who is the car park and trolley assistant realised I had a flat tyre  he came over and tried his best to help but looking at the tyre and even offer wig to help if I needed it! Again I didn t catch his name but would like to say thank you!   You have 2 very helpful members of staff there who went beyond what I would think would be their duties!
