I just wanted to say a massive thank you to a particular staff member at your thirst store. Her name is Jane and I think her badge said she is the checkout supervisor.  Whilst I was shopping Saturday morning with my baby daughter she unfortunately had an accident at the checkout we had just arrived out. Needless to say it wasn t the most pleasant of sights and it turns out she has had a rather bad tummy bug for the last 3 days. Anyway Jane came straight to our aid. Didn t make a big deal out of it at all. She allowed me to take some baby wipes from the shop floor and pay for them when I was done. Whilst I took my little girl to change and clean her up she cleared up the mess  got rid of the ruined food in our trolley and replaced it with new ones and opened up the checkout herself to scan my items through.  My massive thank you for her discretion throughout the whole time and making me feel like it was no inconvenience and once cleaned up treated us like it had never happened.  Some lovely people in this world

Hi Tesco   Please can you sort out your store in Westhill with regards to security tagging on clothes. Every single time I buy a few items of clothing there is always at least one item that still has a security tag on it.  I can appreciate that along with customer service  security is also very important. However today s purchase consisted of a 3 pack of girls wool tights 7-8 and a 2 pack of bog standard girls leggings also 7-8 and like every other time the alarms don t go off leaving the store. So tonight getting my daughters things ready for school and what a surprise security tags on both items under a fiver  really Tesco?. I m quite relieved to say there was nothing in his bag with security tags still attached which is really lucky however it did come to light it was in actual fact a tag in the pocket of the combat trousers i bought him a week earlier for work.   Please sort this out Tesco it s getting silly  thank you x

I was shopping today and got all my favorites but some unhappy happened.  I m not very smart so maybe it was my fault but I m pretty sure it wasn t. I was in the check out line and talking with the nice lady ringing me up ( a collage student who said she s studying for a masters in a new doctors field which is super col she must be very very smart! :)   She was being very nice tome and today was a rare occasion where I was having a god day.  See I m autistic so sometimes I have a really really hard time.  Tesco staff is always really nice to me  and super friendly.  so because I was having a good day we where talking while she scanned my shopping and I packed it.  but at some point (I m not sure when) another customer joined the que (I d like to not that there where other lines  she had less then the limit for the express lane and a lot of the self check out points where open)  Anyway while I was talking this customer Yelled at me.  just right out of no where. Some of my stuff wasn t even done being scanned yet!  I can t move any faster but she treated me like some how her being in a hurry was my fault.  It really upset me.  now this isn t your fault at all Like I said your employees are always super nice. But the lady ringing me up didn t say anything.    I don t know if store policee keeps her from defending customers  but I m worried that maybe I messed up somehow  I don t want to be annoying but I know on my good days  because their not often  I can get enthusiastic  so maybe she was annoyed with me to  but couldn t say so because I m a customer?  I don t know  I m not good with social cues and It seemed to me that our conversation was going very well. but Maybe I did something wrong?  But I don t know what.  and so I ve been really worried that Maybe the reason The lady at the till didn t say anything was because she agreed with the mean lady and was mad at me  but couldn t say so cause of her job?  Um so I was wondering if you could apologize to the cashier for me.  I dunno what her name was she was very nice  she works at the Tesco Hardwick round about in Kings Lynn Norfolk and it was today 8/15/2016 um at around 1:30 2 o clock I think?  I didn t have a watch with me sorry.  Um  But if you could tell her I m sorry if I bothered her I d appreciate it.    Like I said I know that because I m not good with social things i don t always know if I m bothering someone  and she was very nice to me so I don t want to think I was bothering her.  I hope yu can tell her I m sorry.  I couldn t because after the lady yelled I got upset and didn t want to breakdown in the shop so I just paid and left and cried when I got to my momma at the ca. so Please. I d really appreciate it if you could get my message to her.  Thank you very very much.  Oh and again thank you for selling so many of my favorite foods!

I ve just got home from a trip to Tesco  Redruth  and to be honest it s been a nightmare trip. I pulled in at 15.40 to get the few bits I needed (only came to ¬£10 to give you an idea). There wasn t a single parent and child bay available (I m a single parent of a toddler and a 16 week all baby). I appreciate this happens  so I park in a normal bay and walk my toddler across the carpark and carry baby over to get a trolley. In all 3 of your trolley bays there isn t a single infant and toddler trolley  so I end struggling to manoeuvre my toddler into a trolley and carry the baby  pushing the trolley with my remaining arm. No raspberries  so I settle for strawberries. I get to the diary aisle and my baby throws up all over herself and the aisle. I inform the lady on the deli counter as I don t want people to slip. And she sighs and says she ll go get a bucket  no particular concern about her welfare (I appreciate that s not her job but  you know). I don t have enough time to change her before closing so I continue to get my items and go to the checkout  to find one of my yogurts had split. Your checkout lady was really lovely and packed my bag for me as she could see I was struggling. I then take the trolley back to the car and unload the children. I take the trolley back to one of your little huts rather than abandoning it like I often see  but as I get there the wheel locks up. Your trolley man comes up behind me and says that it s okay and he ll get it. So I head back to my car so I can get my vomit covered baby home and changed to have your trolley man call after me saying  well you ve broken the wheel . I appreciate it s nearly 4pm and people want to get home  and each one of these incidents on its own is okay  but in combination all of these little things have caused me to come home feeling very deflated about my shopping experience and some of your staff members today.

Just because I m young(er) and not it in a wheelchair doesn t mean I m not fully entitled to use of the many spaces available.

Today around 3pm I went to tesco allestree at Blenheim parade in Derby. I have no issue with the staff working there they are all lovely and polite.  However on my departure I went to reverse and saw the tesco delivery truck coming so I pulled back into the designated car  parking space for tesco next to the bank and sat patiently with my reverse light on. whilst the lorry adjusted parking 3 times. He then blocked me in. I politely waited and after nearly 10 minutes I had enough and went to look for the delivery driver I looked quite cross but said nothing he then stared over at me and with no apology and yelled at me you can communicate with me ! So he clearly realised he blocked me in. After that I then replied you saw me try to reverse I sat there patiently with my reverse light on then you proceded to block me in. even if he wasnt clearly werent looking at his surroundings safely which isnt a good sign if you cant see someone trying to reverse and  someone sat with a reverse light waiting to get out. That is really bad driving.  why would you clearly block a customer in a parking space . You then with ease reversed it back a couple of meters after me saying something to let me out. And to unblock the car park. As you first arrived I got out of the car to look and there were no other cars behind the lorry so why did he just not do this in the first place. So 2 things I am not happy with him blocking a car in a designated car park and his then attitude towards me yelling at me after realising his fault with no apology. I also had a screaming baby in the back who had been waiting for 10 minutes for me to get home for her milk thats also why I couldn t keep getting out the car to look for him as I was trying to comfort the baby. Im not happy !

I m blind and I honestly used to love going to your shops.  Now I dread walking in to you shops because they are not accessible for me.  I almost always now get the wrong thing because the people i m asking to help me do not understand what I am saying.   This is  I have come to realise  as a direct result of the language barrier.  They do not understand the actual words being spoken.  Also there is the impatience.  While trying to communicate in a way they can understand so that I can get the right things on my list they simply agree with whatever I say and then bring a version of what I ask for and tell me that it is (put in here an exact repetition of the words I used)   It hasn t just happened to me in 1 or even two of your stores.  Is it too much to ask for at least some basic English proficiency in your staff? It is not your buildings that are in danger of becoming truly inaccessible now Tesco  it s your staff.

Tesco Cirencester. I have just wasted two and a half hours waiting for my car to get the gold wash/valet. I left my car at 10.45 and was told to come back in two hours  which is what my receipt said. I arrived back at 1pm  giving them a few mins extra to compete the job. My car HADN T BEEN TOUCHED.   It was a bit difficult to understand what the three men were trying to tell me (perhaps at least one member of staff should speak English)  but it was along the lines of they have been busy and it will only be another 20 minutes. So perhaps you could explain how cars that that WERE NOT waiting at the same time as mine to be cleaned had been?   Two hours is a long time to wait  but I needed to do a little shop and thought I d treat myself to lunch in the cafe. No food from the kitchen as the chef hadn t turned up - again  apparently. Fortunately my coffee was good and the poor chap serving was very apologetic. It s not his fault.  Management - isn t that what you should be doing? Not leave it to the poor chap probably earning a pittance to deal with cheesed off public.  So  this was the last straw to many unhappy experiences at Tesco Cirencester.  Appalling service which sadly sums up the general apathetic manner in which most of your staff carry out their duties.   Waitrose and Aldi here I come. However  what I can never get back is the two hours I ve wasted today.   Yours  very unhappy customer.

Dear Tesco   So it is now 6 weeks since we first reported that a pubic hair was found in one of your ‚ÄúTesco Low Fat Berry Medley Yoghurts‚Äù.  We first reported the incident in store on the 2nd July and then having heard nothing from your customer service team (I asked for the incident to be investigated and then a letter from Tesco explaining the reason for the genital pube in the yoghurt) I raised this via Facebook.  As you can imagine we got an instant response  excellent I thought  we are getting somewhere.    The issue was reported via Facebook on the 27th July.  It is now the 14th August.  We have been away on holiday during that time and still no letter from Tesco when we got home.  A big disappointment.  Perhaps I was wrong and pubic hair is a key ingredient in your Tesco Low Fat Berry Medley Yoghurts  if so would you please be kind enough to highlight this on the packaging so that the customer does not get a surprise when they find the pube located within the half eaten pot.  Happy if pubes are part of the manufacturing process  but as I said please can you make this clear on the packaging in the future so that we can avoid having to purchase any products that contain them.  It would be nice if somebody at Tesco could take this seriously as it is a major failure of your GMP processes to allow genital hairs into your products.  A hair from somebody‚Äôs head or face you can understand if something finds its way in a product by mistake  but not a genital hair.  Seriously though customer service should be your number one priority  without customers you are not able to function correctly.  One customer has a bad experience they tell 10 people  if they have a good one  they may tell one.  Basic customer service is not hard and an organisation like Tesco should have it down to a fine art.  Perhaps you have just got too big and you no longer care about the people who buy from your stores and pay for your wages.  Once again I look forward to hearing from you (maybe)  an apology would be nice and possibly an explanation about how it happened  how you intend on changing your procedure to hopefully stop it happening again  and also how it has taken you so long to send a letter.    You could have walked and hand delivered a letter by now.  Many thanks.  Kind regards   Paul

Hi Firstly I would like to say thanks for your free fruit scheme as it really keeps my eldest quiet and happy as we shop  she rushes in to find it when we go! But I d also like to apologise for a) my daughter eating copious amounts of the fruit  and b) for my youngest that often chews a bit and throws it on your floor and whilst I do try my best to pick it all up in sure I miss bits. But more importantly I want to say thanks. Thanks to a young lady working in your Loughborough The Rushes store. A few weeks ago she served me and asked how I was  I explained that my youngest had just had a big operation and so we were all tired but relieved and just adjusting to life whilst she s in a big cast (being treated for hip Dysplasia so the cast is from her chest to both ankles). I left and thought she was kind and friendly but nothing else. However  this week whilst shopping again she happened to be serving us but I didn t even realise until she said  oh hi how lovely you ve brought your little one today how s she getting on with everything ? I was speechless. Instead of the usual stares and funny looks at her cast someone I didn t know was asking how she was! And she d remembered her and us as a family. I was really touched and it made me smile for the rest of the day. So thank you I have spoken to customer services at The Rushes store but I would equally appreciate you saying thank you/well done to the lady. I am determined to find her name and thank her personally too as I was so touched by her thoughtful comments at the time I completely forgot to check her name and say thank you. As you say  every little helps! And it really does x

I can tell you now I have never been so embarrassed and humiliated in all my life. I certainly will never shop in your stores again.

Dear Tesco  I just wanted to say a massive thanks to one of your employees working in the Northwich store on saturday (13th) afternoon called Leanne.   I had possibly just experienced one of my worst shopping trips ever and her kindness and understanding was overwhelming and massively appreciated.   Earlier on in the day I had taken my little boy Archie to out of hours gp with a severe case of tonsillitis. Needless to say he was not in the mood or health for a shopping trip. However a last minute nappy emergency saw me bundling Archie and his younger sister in the car and headed to your Northwich store.   I have learnt over the last few months not to take both of my children food shopping with me. Archie is nearly 3 and his sister is 18 months old (a mere 15 months between them). They fight and scrap and generally play up together in a trolley at the best of times  leaving me feeling stressed and with only half of what I originally came shopping for.   So today was that but 100 x worse. Archie was inconsolably crying  Erin banged her head and wanted to be held whilst I tried to steer a trolley and throw the essential nappies and any other food I could think of to help soothe Archie s throat. So when I finally arrived at the till not only where both kids crying but so was I.   Leanne saw how I was struggling jumped straight up  unloaded all my shopping  packed it up and reloaded it again allowing  me to comfort the kids.  It meant so much to me and I hope this message can be passed on to her.   A very very grateful customer

Tesco  Giant Sweetie Cupcake  celebration cake - Serves 18. Oh yeah? That must be 18 fairies  elves or pixies cos that s not 18 normal people! The illustration on the side of the box was deceptive  - it looks a decent serving but unless you use a laser to cut it with  have 18 guests all on a diet there s no way to get 18 servings. Be honest and say it serves 8 and if a customer gets 10 slices then they d be smug but to say 18 is cloud cuckoo land. After all that the cake was tasty - just pleased I only had 5 to serve & there s some left over for tomorrow:)

Great service this morning Tesco  not quite perfect but you ve got some great people working for you.  I booked a delivery for this morning but didn t check out in time and lost the slot. When I booked another slot I forgot to amend the address before I checked out so I got a call from the delivery driver at 7.30 this morning asking where I was. Once we d established he was outside my old house he gave me the number of customer services to call to try and sort. I spoke to a lovely lady in customer services and she pleaded with your Crawley delivery centre to deliver to my new address (sadly they wouldn t  that is my only issue with today s service though). Anyway  she was lovely  she deleted my old address from my account so it didn t happen again. Anyway  a bit later on the delivery driver calls me back. He says he was just checking in on me  he said he d seen baby formula in my delivery and had I been able to sort a delivery for today and did I need the formula? I d already rebooked my delivery for tomorrow so was sorted but he didn t have to do that  he didn t have to make sure I was ok. He was lovely. I d like to thank him again  and you should certainly be pleased you have caring staff such as him  and also lovely people like the customer services lady that commiserated with me at 7.30 this morning! Unfortunately I didn t catch either of their names.

My village store is Tesco Express  Belton  Norfolk.  During the week  the regular staff are brilliant  the store is welcoming and customer service is excellent. At weekends it is a totally different story.  The weekend staff have no concept of customer service. This morning - and this is normal for a Saturday - the newspapers were in a complete shambles. I could not find The Times  then realised another gentleman was also looking for one. We eventually found them  under a pile of Daily Mails! We then realised there were no magazines in the paper. We discovered them in a pile  nowhere near The Times. How many people got home to find their paper incomplete I wonder.  I told the girl on the till the papers were in a mess  to which she replied  they didn t arrive in the right order . What on earth does that mean?  To add insult to injury the lottery machine is out of action for the second weekend in as many weeks. The reason  It has run out of paper and we are waiting for it to come in.  Unbelievable.  The store is so bad at weekends  I regularly phone Tesco Customer Service who assure me they take up complaints with the management. But nothing ever happens. What a shambles!

I would like to make a formal complaint against tesco in Wishaw  Scotland and one of its managers. I went to the checkout to pay for a bottle of chambord and was challenged for ID which I provided. My sister who was accompanying me did not have ID despite being 30 years old. We were then refused sale because she did not have ID. When I asked to speak to the manager I was spoken to by a man called Scott  one of the Wishaw store managers and I was absoloutely appalled. We were told that we could have been a couple and that I looked much older than her (I am 5 years younger) so not only did the manager publicly insult me  his attitude towards us was a disgrace. He was snappy  abrupt  and completely rude to me and my sister. We felt so intimidated and were shocked at how poor the customer service was. I feel completely discriminated against because of my age  and I feel he would not have spoken to someone of an older age group in such a manner. I then had to purchase my products from a tesco extra which cost me more than it would have in the larger store! As the person who was buying the product  I had the correct identification and it should make no difference who is with me at the time. If I had children would they be asked for ID aswell?  I have been a customer of tesco for years and I now feel uncomfortable visiting the store again. I want to know what s going to be done about this ASAP  and I feel the manager is a disgrace to the store. I understand the law regarding the sale of alcohol however I have never been treated so poorly in a store in my life!  Regards  Kevin Kelly.

Do you know that 8 potatoes ALWAYS weigh 0.96Kg?  Apparently the radio buttons on your online shopping site is just for conversion between weight and quantity. Please can you advise if you are planning on installing a changing place facility in either of your stores in Ashford Kent?

Dear Tesco You ve just built a brand spanking new  large store in Bicester  and it looks great  apart from one thing.  You have all this space  and all this opportunity  yet you still decide that the baby changing room can be a baby feeding room too.  An uncomfortable chair plonked next to a toilet  in a room with a bin full of nappies is not the right place to feed a baby.  Would you really take your lunch and sit on that chair next to that toilet  smelling those nappies?  Go on  try it  I dare you! Now imagine that you want a nice relaxed lunch  so that you can take your time over your yummy sandwiches  but someone else desperately needs to change a poosplosion (this involves carefully peeling all clothing off a baby  and wondering how on earth so much poo came from such a small person).  You could either rush your lunch  or let the poo in while you finish your lunch off.  Fancy it?  No  nor would a baby  or a mother trying to feed a baby. Please please please stop labelling toilets as appropriate feeding rooms.  There s a cafe upstairs.  Pop a sign up saying  Please feel free to feed in our cafe.  No need to buy any food or drink .  Or consult some real mothers and ask them what they would like in a baby feeding room (Hint: no toilets  a comfy chair or two  and a few toys for the older sibling).  And above all  please keep it seperate from the changing room  as poo and food really do not go well together. You re not alone in doing this  but you can be the one to make the change and show everyone else how to do it right. Go on  pretty please.

Ah tesco...rant time. So we order online every week without fail and don t get me wrong I do love the service but I have a few minor issues. But first let s set the scene we are two working adults with no car and it would cost us a tenner every time we want to get a bus to the nearest supermarket for shopping. We rent a small flat without a freezer....problem number one.  We are trying to be economical  cut down on waste and we plan our meals.  Our delivery we order every Monday and costs us ¬£4. If we don t spend 40 a week it costs us another 4 quid....so we now are forced to spend 40 a week just to justify the cost. That s alot for two of us...plus cat. In addition the food we get is not always fresh.  Take for example today is Wednesday our food arrived on Monday  Chicken for two meals  then mince for today tomorrow.  Can t freeze remember.  Open the mince it s OK for today but won t be good for tomz.  So 2mz dinner in the bin and we will have to get a ready meal from the newsagents on the way home. Again delivery on Monday but by Friday their is no way we can get fresh to last us the weeknd. So we still have to go out and get more food. Our monthly shop is now 200 quid a month minimum....quite a lot for two adults......it s not ideal and it s frustrating and I m fed up of not ever getting fresh enough meat to last the week.....grumble over.

Been a customer of yours for years.  Have ordered loads of clothes for my twins and have always clicked and collected and done my food shopping same time. I placed an order for some sites w for my girls and one pair didn t fit so now I m forced to re order and pay the charge for 1 pair of ¬£ 5 shoes!  Really bit happy at all.  Also why have you changed the invoice that comes with the order?  There s no prices on them and the assistant was really frustrated and had to ask me to see my original order via my phone! Yesterday evening I visited your store in Welling with my dad. As we reached the top of the escalator near the store entrance I noticed an elderly gentleman approach the security guard with his trolley. As my dad stopped to reach his shopping list out of his pocket  I looked back to the elderly man chatting to the security guard. It was pretty evident from hand gestures that he was asking the security guard if he could take the trolley out to the front of the store where his car was parked less about than a metre away so he could unload his shopping. I could also see the security guard was telling him he couldn t. The security guard began pointing down the escalator suggesting that the elderly man could move his car to the underground car park and then bring his shopping down in his trolley. This was when I started to get angry as this was a very elderly gentleman who obviously struggled as not only did he have a walking stick but was also visibly shaking. I can only assume the gentleman said he didn t really want to do this as this was the point the security guard started to remove the bags from his trolley. My dad was just about to go over to help so I told him  no  its fine  the security guard is helping him . I could not believe my eyes when the security guard proceeded to load the elderly gentleman with the bags and it was immediately evident the elderly man was struggling. My dad then ran over to take the bags off of the gentleman before any more could be handed over and help him take them to his car which was literally parked right outside the store entrance. Now I understand that a security guard may not be able to leave his post  but surely there would have been someone in the store he could have called over to assist in a more appropriate fashion. I am assuming the customer care part of the job description would surely cover a small act of common human decency such as this?! I dread to think what could have happened if my dad had not gone over to help him and he instead had attempted this on his own  unaided by his walking stick as he was obviously naturally unsteady on his feet without the numerous shopping bags your security card kindly loaded him with. My main aim of this is just to understand whether this is common practise in matters such as this which I sincerely hope it isn t as I can assure you  it will be the last time myself or my dad shop at Tescos

Today I visited your Tesco Extra Walkden store. Though your store has a VAST range of products  you will understand it s like walking into a grocery filled Narnia. So this has been weighing on my mind all day. I couldn t get to sleep and I can t focus on anything else. I messed up last night. Bad.   I went to get my 18 month old cat  Penny  some delicious wet food from Tesco last night. Her favourite is Rabbit and now that we no longer own Rabbits  she s allowed to eat it again.   So my wife and I spent at least 10 minutes checking EVERY SINGLE PACK of wet food in the huge Reading Tesco aisle. Finally  we find some Sheba Wet food. 50p each or 8 for ¬£3 - essentially buy 6  get 2 free.   What happened next mortifies me. Please stop reading here if you re of a sensitive disposition.  In my haste to exit the store  I collected what I believed to be 8 packs of the delicious Sheba Wet food. However  when I got home to feed young Penny  I saw there were only 7. That s right  7  packs of tasty  refined rabbit. 1 less than the required amount to trigger the 8 for ¬£3 deal.   I scrambled urgently to find the receipt and confirm my suspicions. I was right. Instead of spending ¬£3 on Penny s dinner and breakfast for the next four days  I had spent ¬£3.50 for only 3 and a half days.   Not only am I now 50p poorer than I should be  Penny will now have to skip a meal.   Never in my life have I felt so much shame. I ve let Penny down  I ve let my wife down  I ve let Myself down and most importantly  I ve let my British Money-saving pride down.   Please  when shopping at Tesco do not repeat my mistakes. Be wary.

When going into the store there was another lovely sports car with a young lad sat waiting with his window down  no disabled badge so I said politely  you do know you are parked in a disabled space and shouldn t be   so he said  Id better move then . when getting in the store I asked a young assistant in a suit  who was responsible for watching people don t park in the disabled spaces?  as there were cars right now parked there and there always are every time I visit and he said the security team. My wife and I  both longstanding Clubcard holders  have been considering on-line shopping with you for a long time but have desisted because of concern about being delivered fresh items with short shelf-lives. I am contacting you on behalf of my friend Mrs A  ** *********** *******  New Wanstead  London  E11. She is a pensioner and on the 29 July had care of her disabled adult son  Mr F who lives in a specialist residential home in Northamptonshire. On the 29 July at 15.11h Mrs F had attempted to park her car in a disabled parking bay outside Tesco Express on Wanstead High Street so that she could push her son in his wheelchair to choose some food for dinner. Mrs A and her son were verbally attacked by one of your staff for legaly parking in a disabled space outside of the store. Your driver  an eastern european man was driving delivery lorry  Mercedes KM61 RXX. He shouted at her and her son that he had been waiting to use the  disabled  space for twenty minutes to make a delivery and she had better move out if his way or he would move her car with his truck! She got out of her car and showed him her son s blue badge  he completely disregarded this and continued to verbally abuse her and her son with increasing anger. Your employees threatening behaviour forced Mrs F to flee the space in fear for hers and her son s safety. Mrs F saw a traffic enforcement officer as she drove away from outside the store. She stopped her car to tell the enforcement officer what had happened in the disabled space outside of the tesco store. He told her he could not do anything about the incident Mrs F and her son had experienced but that he would certainly go and give your lorry a parking ticket. This man will remember Mrs F. Mrs F then drove off to find an appropriate place to park so where she would be able to push her son in his wheelchair and buy some food  they went into the bakery on the high street where the member of staff is also likely to remember her and her son due to their distress. Mrs A took her phone out during the incident intending to take a photo of the registration number of the lorry so that she could report your driver  fortunately she accidentally took a short video in which she can be heard very upset  telling your driver she will not argue with him but she will report him to Tesco. I am not able to attach the video but have attached a still from it to this message. I will retain the video for your viewing should this be required.  Mr F was born with a chromosonal condition called Trisomy 13  this means he has a severe intellectual disability and physical abnormalities in many parts of his body. Mr F also has heart defects  brain and spinal cord abnormalities  poorly developed eyes and extremely weak muscle tone. Mr F also has Type 1 diabetes and is partially sighted and hearing impaired. Mr F has been left traumatised by the behaviour of your employee and due to his conditions he cannot make sense of what happened to him and his mum.He is 39y of age and has a mental age of 8y.  I am extremely upset by the completely inappropriate behaviour of one of your employees and upset by the hugely detrimental impact this has had on my friend and her extremely vulnerable son.  To add to the distress  Mrs A has subsequently received a penalty charge notice for stopping in a bus lane 4 minutes after this incident as she spotted a Parking Enforcement Officer and stopped to explain to him what had happened. This fine is ¬£55 increasing to ¬£165 in 28 days. I have challenged this on her behalf on the basis of her predisposition following the attack by your driver! How many more vulnerable people has he abused?  An apology from the driver and TESCO is the least we expect for Mrs A and her son Mr F.

Dear Tesco  Last night I had the most amazing experience at you Southampton branch. It was my first time  clicking and collecting  and the moment is one I will never forget!  I was nervous to begin  but was eased through the process gently as a first timer should be  and my overall experience was one I will never forget! I was hesitant at first and even went to the wrong location. Bi-product of nerves I suppose  but the person who directed me to where I had to go to collect my groceries was really helpful and even took my empty trolley from me that I collected through habit! I made my way to the click and collect area and the chap was very happy to hold my hand through this life changing process  explained about the  substitutions  and helped me to load my stuff into the car despite me being the last customer of the day! He was very friendly and offered a lot of encouragement.  After getting back in my car  I felt a big sigh of relief knowing that the 3 mins I had spent there will forever change my life for the better. I found myself telling everyone about it to the point people were asking why I was so excited. It just felt good for my first time and know I ll come back for more!  I love you Mr Tesco! Xx #tescoforever #sainsburyshavenothingonyou #whoaremarksandspencer

I decided to make a change from Sainsburys and visit my local Tesco (Warfield  Bracknell) but not sure it was the wisest move! After finally securing my 10mth old son in the trolley I entered the store to b met with some form of alarm going off  as the security were not stopping anyone entering we assumed it must be a drill and went to start our shopping. I was approached shortly after entering by a female member of staff to say it s not a drill and we r evacuating. She asked me to empty my trolley and then leave!?!?! I only had some birthday cards so thankfully it didn t take long üò° I followed the general stream of staff as no one was instructing us where to go for the fire assembly point. I stood amongst some staff in a huddle and noticed they took the time to check Facebook  take selfies and have a cigarette! I was furious as my baby was next to them at this point! A staff member pointed out we weren t even half way to the official meeting point!!!! But the shoppers were left outside the main store door! So dangerous üò° what a shambles! Clearly this store don t care whether their customers r burnt???? Poor manners  bad conduct and atrocious safety knowledge. I will NOT be returning and putting myself and my son in danger ever again!

Really annoyed and disappointed with the Barry store. Once again there are loads of empty shelves. Once again a promotion is running and surprise  surprise - only one part of the two part promotion is instore. The usual place for the promotion has been filled with other similar items on promotion (but NOT the item that was originally there.) They turned up hidden further into the store on the top shelf towards the end of the aisle. The promotion was clearly printed on the box  but there was no sign of the second item. Thinking that a staff member may have  hidden  them somewhere else entirely we searched the store. Finally giving up looking we went and asked a member of staff for help. She was very helpful and took us straight to where they should have been (which is exactly where we had first looked). She was surprised to see that they were no longer there  so went and found a member of staff who she said could give us more information.  When he appeared he tried to tell us that they had NEVER sold the second item in that store. When I pointed out that I had bought it there a number of times in the past he tried to back-track and say that they only get it in very infrequently.  It comes in for a little while and goes again.  I told him that that was NOT the case as I had seen it there almost permanently over the last year or so. He then looked really sheepish and said that they don t have it and it only came in for a part of the promotion  it sold out and that they aren t going to be selling it again. I told him that it was wrong to be selling the other item with the promotion printed on it if they had no intention of fulfilling the offer. He said that they were only a small store and that if we wanted the offer we needed to go to the bigger ones. When asked again about why they were selling only one half of a promotion (and that being the item with the offer printed on it) he said that  Tesco buy everything in bulk  so we may end up with items that have offers on them that we don t do here.  I told him that y couldn t do that as it was false advertising and as such it is illegal to do so. I also pointed out that it wasn t the first time that this particular store has had empty shelves when a promotion is on. We have been in quite a few times in the past and found this to be the case. It is amazing how the shelves are  magically  full once again the very first day after the promotion has ended. This cannot be a coincidence so many times.  As we went through the checkout a different member of staff confirmed that she too had bought the item a number of times from there so how can the store claim that they had NEVER sold it?!!!  SHAME ON YOU TESCO STORE IN BARRY  SOUTH WALES!!!  I think that I should go back to shopping at Morrisons or Asda  as I still have to go there to get the rest of my shopping tomorrow due to so many items not being available today.

Hi Tesco  I wanted to message to say a HUGE thank-you to the Tesco delivery driver who delivered my mum s shopping today. When he arrived with her shopping  she was desperately ill and incoherent. He made sure she was okay and that my dad was on his way back home to her  and then as she was too unwell to do it for herself  he went massively above and beyond and unpacked all her frozen and refrigerated goods and put them away for her so they didn t spoil. I want him to get the recognition he deserves for not only doing his job fantastically well  but also for being a lovely human being. We are very grateful to him for what he did today.

I was extremely disappointed today to discover that the community rooms at tesco beaumont leys had taken away the Leicester Cloth Nappy Libraries space in order to give it to a profit making business. This has left me and many others extremely disappointed. Why do profit making groups get priority over a non for profit group ran entirely by volunteers? The cloth nappy library is a huge help to those locally as not only does nic provide support and advice to those using cloth but she also lends out long term nappy kits to those who simply can t afford nappies and would have to chose between food or nappies for their children. How can you call a community room as such when the community isn t the most important factor in who uses it? Having been to the group weekly not once did the lady who organises the room come to meet us and ask how the group supported families  she didn t see how any passing family were welcome wether they used cloth nappies or not in order to let their kids play and chat to other mums. This in itself is lovely for local mums as some mothers at home are so starved of adult company they often pop up tescos just to get out of the house. However when attending another local group (profit making) I saw the lady who runs the room everytime and she was all over the companies who used the room. I am so disappointed in the situation. Maybe you should remember that community doesn t mean profits!!

The number of cancer cases are increasing every day and a large number of these cancers are caused by pesticides and herbicides used by farmers. The manufacturers of the chemicals say they are safe to humans  but the people who apply the chemicals have to wear HazMat suits so how can this stuff be safe? and they are spraying it on our FOOD!!   Any substance sprayed on a porous surface will be absorbed and become part of the plant.  This will be ingested and sit in the human body until it causes problems. I don t buy food that has been factory farmed. I only buy organic. Organic food is real food and should be marked as such.  Food suppliers demand for profit should not be held more important than the lives and wellbeing of the people.

Thank you to your Dunmow store for offering free fruit to children. I went to pick a banana for my 15 month old but she reached for an apple instead. She has apples at home but I slice them for her  however as she clearly wanted one I let her. To my surprise she managed to bite the apple (with just 10 teeth!) and eat the whole thing! She was so happy to be able to hold and eat the whole piece of fruit! I never would have given her a whole apple to eat at home so thank you for the opportunity for showing myself and my daughter just how capable she is at eating things by herself!

I think you need to sort out your arrangement with hermes. Ordering school clothes online was easy but delivery was terrible. Most of my order was missing. Tesco rearranged items to be sent ASAP (thank you tesco) Missing items were then received with extra trousers that I d already received (rang back to be told that I could keep them for inconvenience caused by the screw up) kept receiving 2 items I hadn t ordered for me to realise yesterday after receiving a delivery it was because they shared the same order number with the item I ordered.  Again rang back to explain why you kept sending me wrong items and what could I do with them (told me to take back to store for refund). Got woken up this morning by a delivery driver with original missing items. Rang tesco yet again as you was waiting for jumpers to come back into stock to send to me and these came this morning. Spoke to a rude person who told me under no certain terms I had to return all duplicate items to a tesco store ASAP other wise you would charge me for the extra you sent including the trousers I had been told I could keep. I ordered online as it was an easier option with 3 young kids (one with severe learning and behaviour disabilities) it s not my fault that hermes screwed up my order. It would of been easier for me to take all 3 kids in store to buy the clothes in the first place and put up with my son s meltdowns in store as I now have to go there anyway with them but this time they will have to wait patiently (not going to happen) in a line at customer services and then wait quietly (really not going to happen) for me to explain this whole mess to the staff at customers service ............  Thanks for the hassle guys

Just so you know.   I purchased some of your own brand odourless cat litter the other day. Your packaging RAVES about itself.   After 2 days of use I can categorically say it is the most horrendous smelling thing I have ever purchased. If anything  it smells even worse than what cats actually do in it.   Don t get me wrong I know cat poo stinks right  but I also know what it smells like.... but somehow  hideously  as soon as it hits this litter it s smell becomes something entirely different.   Different is an understatement in fact  as it became something I would only expect to experience if I had to enter the seven circles of hell. I literally nearly dropped dead on the spot  my brain nearly haemorrhaged when I just opened the kitchen door and was hit by its  odourless  odour.   Anyway  just FYI  because somebody high up needs to know to check their staff can smell before they employ them to test odourless products in future.   Other than that  I bought a lovely onion to make a pasta bake the other night. Very rich in flavour.  Have a good night.

Hi tesco   I ve just moved into a different area closer to your Skegness store than your Cleethorpes store. I have to say it a fair bit of a change in terms of stores. I feel Skegness is a bit smaller and lacks a few of what I think are essentials  however the joe bloggs of Skegness may not appreciate my necessities.   Definitely been wondering where the lack of scan and shop is in the store as well. My wife has been left with an extra free hand to add more unnecessary things to the trolley. Costing me a small fortune.  However in my 3 weeks of going to your Skegness store on a Monday night I have found some joy from the lack of scan and shop. That joy was in the form of Joshua on the tills. Been to his till twice and he was very enthusiastic and chatted to me about different things. Even when I needed bags he gave me the correct amount I needed for my shop. All in all fantastic. Joyous service and efficient all in one. The one thing I didn t realise was that he has only been there 3 weeks.   So my plea to you tesco is look after this young gent. He is an excellent example of what your staff can be and I just hope he continues to enjoy his job and deliver joy as well as good shopping. Please don t let him be another little drone and beat the personality out of him. Look after his little spark.  Pretty much I had an alright time chatting to your guy at the till and he seems like a good guy in your organisation.

ANYONE CONSIDERING ORDERING FROM THE EASY ENTERTAINING RANGE PLEASE BE AWARE THAT EVEN IF YOU PROVIDE TESCO WITH THE REQUIRED NOTICE THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO GUARANTEE YOU WILL RECEIVE YOUR ORDER!!!!! I recently placed an order for the Tesco Easy Entertaining range for a special party we were having on Saturday 6th Aug.  They ask that you give 3/4 days notice  more on some items when placing the order. I assumed that this was so they could ensure they had sufficient time to prepare my food.  Unfortunately  I was wrong. I received an email Fri evening  my delivery was booked for between 10pm and 11pm  to advise me that the mini classic cupcakes I d ordered were unavailable.  I spoke to customer service who said he would contact the dot com manager in the store who would ring me back.  He didn t  but the c/s advisor did to let me know there was a supplier issue and that I hadn t been charged. Really! I certainly would not expect to pay for something you couldn t supply.  My delivery arrived early and the driver was lovely  the only positive thing about this whole experience  but when checking my order we found that not only were the 36 classic cupcakes missing but so were 36 mini cupcakes and 60 mini savoury eggs. The driver was very apologetic  he knew nothing about the shortages  even though they are supposed to be advised.  Once again I had to ring customer service to complain. The girl I spoke to found it hard to believe there were no substitutes at all for the mini savoury eggs. I know I d ordered the value range but surely supplying the next price range up would have provided better customer service than sending nothing at all!  Saturday morning was spent trying to source 72 mini cupcakes and 60 mini savoury eggs  something that I had expected to prevent by ordering from the Easy Entertaining range.  Having successfully found the necessary items in Asda  I returned home to receive a phone call from my local Tesco to tell me the cupcakes had come in on the delivery that morning and were available if I wanted them. I told her  very politely  that I d had to get them elsewhere and that I wouldn t be using or recommending that service to anyone  ANYONE CONSIDERING ORDERING FROM THE EASY ENTERTAINING RANGE PLEASE BE AWARE THAT EVEN IF YOU PROVIDE TESCO WITH THE REQUIRED NOTICE THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO GUARANTEE YOU WILL RECEIVE YOUR ORDER!!!!!

2 weeks ago.. Our Microwave from Tesco s caught fire when I say caught fire I mean flames/smoke and the most awful smell ever  it required a fire blanket etc to put out the flames..  But this could have been a much different post as my little boy was in the kitchen at the time..  I decided was gonna take my barely used microwave back to the store (Oak Tree Lane  mansfield) I had the but could I heck as like find the receipt  I have every receipt back to 2010 lol) Once in-store I explained the situation to Mel (Tech) he told me not to worry as customer service could track the transaction my club card history.. and phoned them for me-i explained the situation to customer service although they were helpful they said it would take up to two weeks to track the transaction.. I was a bit miffed but ok with this as I really just wanted Tesco to be aware there was an issue with this microwave.. especially given the fact it had also scorched my worktop on a 30 second bottle warm.  However Mel wasn t.. he looked over the microwave and was shocked/almost 4 days later the smell in-store was toxic from the microwave.  He said he was going to get the store manager and show him.. again the manager was shocked..  Mel said there was no way this should have happened and that if there was anything that could be done he d find it..  During my time in-store he listened.. was polite/knowledgeable and curtious and a true gentleman.  He understood that I d been uncomfortable about taking the item back but reassured me I d done the right thing..  In the end I did get a full refund on my microwave but opted to do some research before purchasing another microwave.  I think alot of staff and other stores learn alot from this guy..  Fabulous customer service!!  P.s. I have tried numerous times to write this review your website using the correct methods but It won t work/save???

RWAF has named and shamed you this morning for selling cruel housing. As a big retailer you should be setting a good example. Shame on you.

Dear Tesco   I have thought long and hard about posting this but I am so upset by what happened to me in your Yeovil store this morning I feel that I must.   I was shopping in the Yeovil store this morning using the scan and shop system. When I got to the scan and shop check out at roughly 10am the system told me that my shopping had been selected to be checked. Fine  no problem  or so I thought! The operator came over scanner in hand to check my shopping  she scanned a few items  then said she needed to check her scanner as something hadn t scanned  no problem  the operator came back and scanned again  then said that there was a problem and asked me to move my trolley over. The operator then said that she was going to have to scan the entire shop  didn t explain why  no problem  I thought. When unpacking my shop  I noticed that a tray of potatoes had split  I asked if I could change them and was told  go and find them yourself  so I did. When I returned to the scan and shop checkout  the operator was stood with another colleague and they were both looking at me very oddly. The operator who had checked my shop  then announced in a VERY loud voice that I had over ¬£27 of shopping that had not scanned. The operator then turned to her colleague and said again very loudly  What happens now? Do I need to call security?  I was absolutely mortified. I had no idea how this had happened. I tried to explain that I scanned every single item  however this was sniffed at. When I suggested the possibility that the scanner I had used might be faulty  I was told that this couldn t possibly be the case as the operator was using my scanner. This actually wasn t the case as she had arrived with the scanner in her hand. I tried to point this out but again was cried down and made to feel like I was a criminal. It was awful  so embarrassing with other shoppers staring. I have no idea what happened with my shopping  it has never happened before and will never happen again as I will never be returning to shop at Tesco again. I have cut up my club card. It was an absolutely hideous experience. To add insult to injury  when I returned home and unpacked my shopping  the operator had obviously dropped a large tub of yoghurt whilst repacking it when I had gone to get find the tray of potatoes because the bottom had split and yoghurt had gone all over the rest of my shopping in the bag.

I went in to Tesco extra in Walsall today with my 2 year old boy. I never usually take him because he hates shopping and sitting in the trolley but had no choice today. Before we had  even walked in to Tesco he decided to throw a temper tantrum I then succeeded in getting him into the trolley and started shopping walking past the free fruit for children (brilliant idea). My son almost fell out the trolley in his temper even though I had strapped him in he had pulled himself free. He then wanted mummy cuddles and when I tried to put him down again to walk he just wanted to get back up. I was almost in tears by this point and about to give up shopping all together go home and go hungry (no food in the house) it was so busy being a Saturday and lots of shoppers had walked past watching me struggle. Then Steph came to my recuse she had been handing out the free fruit and witnessed everything she dropped what she was doing and pushed my trolley around the store for me so that I could carry my son  she spoke to him and claimed him down and entertained him while we walked round. She even offered to put my shopping on the till and pack it for me by this point my son had calmed down and become his usual playful self. Steph went above and beyond and this one small act of kindness had such an impact on our day  I can t express how much I appreciated her help  Tesco you have an amazing employee. Thank you Steph

***KICKED WHILE YOU ARE DOWN***  Having been a regular online home delivery customer due to stage 3 advanced Cancer I am appalled to be treated the way I have been over the past 24hrs. I cannot drive due to the vast amount of meds I have to take  in the last 6 weeks i have been let down  lied to  and brushed off 5 out of 6 times!! Thats an 83% failure rate!! I ordered my shopping to be delivered last night between 10-11pm  its gets to 11:10pm  I try to ring to ask where my shopping is  Conveniently the lines shut at 11pm so no joy there. I ring at the earliest opportunity this morning to be told I was contacted yesterday to notify me of a problem and a message was left   THIS IS A LIE !! then a very unfriendly and unhelpful Angela (MA10 is her ID code I believe) tells me that the best she is willing to do is reschedule for tomorrow lunchtime. Should I starve until then as I cannot drive to any shops? Should I be a PRIORITY as it was YOU who FAILED yet again? Its bad enough having your life turned upside down  spending 6 months in hospital  being in a coma for 2 of the 6 months  enduring chemo and radio therapy  but talk about being kicked while you are down !! I previously shopped at the Culverhouse cross store and was always extremely happy with the service  especially a few key people helping me with shopping and getting to and from my car when I could drive (Mel from scan and shop deserves a mention) but was unable to walk. Your level of service has spiralled downwards !! I was under the impression your slogan is  Every little helps  ? My question is ...HOW ARE YOU HELPING A LOYAL CUSTOMER BY LEAVING THEM TO STARVE KNOWING THEY CANNOT SHOP WITHOUT YOUR DELIVERY SERVICE?? IS THAT THE LITTLE BIT THATS HELPING ME ? I THINK NOT !!. I look forward to your response and how you intend to rectify this issue knowing you and your staff are happily kicking someone while they are down!  P.s. it says on my online orders that you have delivered my shopping !!! PRICELESS !!!
Quite disappointed that there aren t any family days out in Nottinghamshire that I can use my club card vouchers with :/ considering all the things there are here.

Early morning visit to your Camelon  Falkirk store today.  After a late(ish) night  no alcohol involved  not a very good sleep then an early rise to drop eldest child off at his Uncle s in Falkirk I decided to do my weekly shop whilst I was out and about. One takeaway coffee in my hand and I find myself in the vegetable aisle staring at the produce. A lovely member of staff approached me (apologies  didn t get her name - still half asleep) and asked me if I was okay before offering to do my shopping for me.  Bless her. Giving myself a shake I declined her kind offer. Further round the store I couldn t find an item I was looking for and your Australian/NZ colleague (sorry  don t know her name either) came to my rescue having had less sleep than I had (we had a blether).  Eventually deciding I had finished my shopping I was served by Chris at the checkout and his usual chatty  friendly manner finally woke me up :-) The point of this post I hear you ask....well  I just want to highlight how helpful and friendly the staff at the store are. I believe appreciation goes a long way and I d be very happy if you could pass on my thanks to a great team.

I was shopping in your Kidsgrove  Stoke on trent store yesterday afternoon and was buying a meal deal that included a bottle of wine along with a few other bits and bobs with my Mum. We went to self scan and one of the colleagues come to confirm my age for the wine. She asked what it was we had that needed confirming  I replied with it being just the wine and showed her the bottle to which she shouted  NO  at me after looking me up and down. Pretty confused and shocked I replied with that I have my ID and went rummaging into my bag for my purse  pretty embarrassed as the woman had shouted it so loud it had brought attention from other shoppers. Before I could get my ID out she pressed confirm and walked away muttering something to herself that I couldn t hear.  I work in a Sainsburys myself and I m fully aware of the think 25 policy that most supermarkets hold. Despite the sheer rudeness from the member of staff I found it more shocking that she didn t physically take my ID to look at after causing such a scene. I m 20 years old and I think I look quite young for my age  and obviously being 20 I qualify to be asked for ID under the think 25 policy so it s quite worrying thinking that things like this are happening in this store!

I had an extremely lovely experience at your store on Cardington Road  Bedford today  I have completed online feedback but would like the member of staff  Malachai  who was so great to be extra thanked and rewarded please!  I bought my daughter a two-figure Peppa Pig toy set whilst shopping. Once finished and putting the trolley back one toy was missing. Somehow my daughter had lost it and a member of staff sorting the trollies (Malachai) helped me to look for it. We couldn t find it so I said don t worry and thank you for trying. He then said that we could go in and get another. I said don t worry wasn t necessary but he insisted. We went to where I originally got the toy set but there were none left of that particular one  Malachai then suggested another set  which was actually bigger than the original. He said we needed to go to the customer service desk so I just assumed he would ask it to be given as a good will gesture. Malachai actually wanted to pay for the toy himself! I am so incredibly grateful to him and the kindness he showed myself and my daughter. He is an invaluable member of your team and an outstanding human being. He showed compassion and care and has left me feeling very touched. It was a small act of kindness that has had a great impact.   Tesco please reward him and pass on the kindness to him as he has shown to me. Thank you.  Helen

Yesterday I started a hunt for play sand that I needed for a kids party on the same day. I called the number for my local store to check stock (as i live 2 miles away and don t drive). When I got there I checked the obvious places to no avail and proceeded to customer services where I was greeted by a helpful staff member who checked the system  agreed the instock number and came with me to the location suggested on the system. But nope. No sand! The guy then offered to look out the back where he says he roped two others into looking but still no play sand! Much to the disappointment of my 3 year old and frustrating for myself we left empty handed and walked the two miles home again.   Now I am not entirely sure how you lose 80 kilos of sand but I was incredibly annoyed after the excursion and left feeling I had completely wasted my time! Cheers for that Tesco üò©

A member of Tesco s clothing team suggested I post on Facebook as apparently I am not the only customer with this problem. I recently picked 5 totally different style tops from the F&F range but none of them were available in my size  despite them not being in the sale and trying several branches. I was also unable to find any of the 5 tops online and rang the main customer service line where a very unhelpful  lady told me she could not use the style numbers or bar codes I had copied down. The branches were also unable to help me due to a new I.T system which is not as good as the previous one. I realise it is my fault that I am fat but I am told my staff and am aware with my own eyes that stores receive batches of each style with lots of 10 s  12 s and 14 s and very few of the larger sizes. There may be as little as 2 size 20 s for example in each delivery. As the majority of women are size 16 and over and the sale racks are full of the smaller sizes which are unsold  is it time that the powers that be who order sizes into stores increase the number of larger sizes?!

So me and my Daughter Primrose  decided to do our weekly shop in Tesco Hookwood - Gatwick yesterday. The trip started off so well  she was playing peekaboo  laughing and giggling at people passing the trolley. The as we approached the biscuit aisle  she went pale and projectile vomited everywhere! And when I say everywhere I mean  down herself  in the trolley  in the shopping bag underneath her full of shopping  her coat and her changing bag hanging underneath her on the little hooky thing.....upon picking her up out the trolley  she was sick again...even worse! It Hit all previous places and then my jeans  my top and managed to find its way in my trainers. At first I was calm thinking someone would offer to help whilst I stripped her down  they didn t  (I can understand why  the amount of sick was a phenomenon - shes tiny - where it all came from I ve no idea!) I managed to grab a lady and ask her to get someone to help me. Her husband ran off to get someone and she stayed with me until he arrived. (Thank you lovely lady  I was genuinely panicking by this point!) The poor lad had no idea what he was about to walk into  he asked if I was Ok...I burst into tears  he immediately stepped up.  Michael  got me some baby wipes  and sent someone else off to get a bucket and began to unpack the sick covered shopping and listed what was there so he could get me new items. Primrose still naked at this point apart from a nappy because Mum of the Year award goes to me forgetting to pack a change of clothes  Michael notices and calls a Manager  Kevin  immediately who tells me to go upstairs and pick anything I wanted to put Primrose in. Through my tears and sobbing on the phone to my other half at this point I pick something for her  changed her and headed downstairs again. I was greeted by a trolley of fresh shopping  Michael and another Manager John. He managed to get a smile out of Primrose and more sobbing out of me! He told me Michael would finish my shopping with me  and he did. He pushed the trolley  grabbed and bleeped the shopping until we were finished and my other half appeared! (I d begged him to come help me because I was having a mental breakdown!) after leaving Tesco I called my Mum and had another breakdown for being so stupid at not being able to keep it together! But genuinely owe Michael and the other staff at Tesco a massive thank you and I will be sending a letter to head office to inform them of their amazing team!!  You have an amazing team at Hookwood  they were attentive  helpful  calming and most of all friendly and reassuring. I am yet to find out this young mans surname so I can send him a little thank you. So if you could help me do this it would be fantastic as Customer services didn t seem to know.  Truly the best customer service I ve ever received.  Thank you again.  Louise & a very sicky Primrose! x

Dear Tesco  in particular club card  Please can you look to your bereavement policy?  Recently my father sadly died and Mum and Dad s club card is in his name. So this was on the long list of people to advise. Obviously we went to the bank first and your club card was further down the list of priority.  My dad died of mesothelioma which is a cancer brought on by asbestos  which in the eyes of the law is not like other cancers and is classed as unnatural death and therefore we have to go through an inquest. This is obviously upsetting as in our case it won t tell us anything we don t already know and the Coroner Officer has advised us that effectively this is a form filling exercise which will just take time.  Why am I telling you this? This means that at present we only have two interim death certificates  unlike death certificates you cannot buy more  although we have got certified copies from the Solicitor.  Mum contacted Tesco club card and we have experienced two problems:  First  Tesco club card does not accept interim death certificates. We had no problems with the Bank who accepted it immediately and the joint accounts have immediately changed and the sole accounts are in the process of being changed  so no need to wait for the death certificate.  Second  once we have the death certificate (dad died on 7 July and the Coroner Officer advised yesterday that she was hopeful we would get it by the end of September) you apparently don t accept a certified copy. Therefore  we have to send an original which we will have to purchase.  I trust you understand that at this upsetting time your policy actually make the process worse.  How is it that Banks will firstly accept interim death certificates and secondly accept certified copies and you don t?

Hi   I placed order 4BXFKXFTV On 27th of July. The order was supposed to arrive on Monday the 1st August and I recieved a text that it would arrive between 7 and 11am. The courier did not arrive and I had to leave to go to work. No card was left!  No word or details to contact the carrier I was unable to let them know I would be at work. When I arrived home on the second  a card had been left with a number.  I called the number and left a voicemail as there was no answer. I recieved a text the next morning on the third. The person did not respond again.  I rang again and left another voicemail around 10am  again offering 2 different numbers to reach me on to rearrange delivery  no answer or response. I called yet again 45 minutes later  no answer. This time I was advising that there would be someone home to receive the delivery. My husband was actually home ALL day as he had changed work plans. There was NO delivery attempt yet again and no phone all to discuss.  I checked your site to see the status of the order as I was off again today and available to receive the order. It says that delivery was attempted at 13.45 on Wednesday (forget that the text said delivery would be between 7 and 11). Irrespective  someone was at home the entire day on Wednesday.   I have 2 young children who hear a pin drop. We are awake from 5.30 each morning until around 11pm. We did not miss the delivery  your carrier did not even attempt to deliver the parcel.  I m not sure whether these carriers are using their own vehicles  or whether they are using company vehicles. I myself am the logistics manager for my company and know this can be checked by looking at any installed tracker on the vehicle.  Given this situation I strongly suspect that this isn t the first time this particular individual has lied about attempting to make a delivery. 3 alleged attempts.... 1 card recieved.... 3 phone calls .... 0 returned phone calls.  I m extremely disappointed by this service and would hope that Tesco Direct would also be disappointed by the appalling service provided by your contracter.  I expect this to be investigated and I would also like an explanation on why I was not contacted and why they provided false information of delivery on Wednesday (in particular) but also Monday delivery ... Based on the lack of a delivery card on both of these days.  To add  I have never had any issues with delivery or communication with your biggest direct delivery competitor  Asda  and many others as I spend around ¬£300 on online shopping per month.   I look forward to your response. In the meantime I will post this on social media as that may provide a quicker response.  Regards Nada MacKenzie  Nee: Pirrie

I would just like to praise the Tesco Extra store in St.Neots  Cambridgeshire. 2 days ago (2.8.16) between 10-11am myself and my two teenage Children were getting a bit of shopping  and a young worker (roughly aged 16/17) collapsed and had a fit in the isle  the staff were outstanding  within seconds they had some staff attending to him  other staff ensured all customers exited the isle swiftly  other staff blocked off the isle at either end explaining to customers that wanted to go down that isle that there s an incident so they wouldn t be able to use that isle at the moment  then another member of staff come running passed us distressed saying  not my son please not my son  other members of staff took her to the lad  which turned out to be her son (every mums worst nightmare) the staff then encouraged the lady to go out the back  reassuring her her son was being looked after by first aiders on site and that an ambulance was on the way  it was a really emotional time  all the staff in the store new there was something wrong with one of their Colleagues yet every worker on shift remained calm  professional and reassured customers the whole time  a massive pat on the back to the team on shift that day  I ve heard the lad is still in hospital undergoing tests as to why he had a fit and fingers crossed all will be ok  but I really think the staff deserve credit where it s due here! Well done Tescos :)

Why do you have self scanning if you are only going to rescan the items yourself? I had half a trolley of items and had scanned them all in amounting to just over ¬£100. I got to the end and was  randomly  selected to be checked. I was the only person using the self scanner. Your assistant came over said she had to do a check and then proceeded to scan some items. She then walked off to her cupboard and scanned something on the door  she came back  scanned some more items  walked off did the same thing with the cupboard door. She came back asked me if I d scanned the same item twice and what bar code I d scanned on the in store bakery French stick  not explaining what or why and then continued to scan the rest of my shopping. I told her that she can scan all the shopping and when she had finished could confirm I hadn t taken anything without scanning it. Thought I d share extract of a complaint to Tesco. I ve shopped at Perivale for 24 years so a bit disappointed at the treatment by overzealous managers demonstrating an amazing willingness to exercise stubbornness over common sense...  Shockingly bad customer service at Perivale. Apparently in his (Alan the manager - although he wasn t sure) judgement Gina is buying the wine for her younger sister (no proof or any other indication of this). I was a bit stumped  I ve shopped in Tesco s for 24 years  bought alcohol with my kids in tow without a problem. I asked for the policy on this. Alan s turn to be stumped. Another manager pointed to the sign on the till  but I pointed out that it references proof of age NOT anything else certainly not any policy about the expertise your staff has in profiling customers to determine how people will behave (proof of age was provided in case you were wondering). I challenged this and asked for the policy and guidance on this. There must be some sort of guidance otherwise how can you determine any judgement is valid. This was refused. In fact rather than properly justify really poor customer service  I  was told to complain to head office and then they proceeded to walk away. The attitude of your management frankly stinks. I d suggest doing a mystery shopper exercise on them  as you surely don t wish this behaviour to be representative of your company. Anyhow of course we left empty handed  and hugely dissatisfied. I hope you will  look into this and provide an explanation to me. As for your managers I d suggest some refresher customer service training.

Dear Tesco   Yesterday a fraudster accessed my clubcard account and spent my vouchers on cinema tickets. You ve gave me the points back  but won t tell me which email address the vouchers were sent to. Apparently when enabling fraud  every little helps .  Giving that the email address is on my account I believe I have a right to view said email address. Given that the DPA gives exceptions that allows it. Or is giving out personal details only something you do to for fraudsters and not against them?  I ll just follow up with some parts of the DPA:  Part II - Section 7 -  (4) Where a data controller cannot comply with the request without disclosing information relating to another individual who can be identified from that information  he is not obliged to comply with the request unless‚Äî  (b)it is reasonable in all the circumstances to comply with the request without the consent of the other individual. (I would say commiting fraud would make it reasonable)  (6)In determining for the purposes of subsection (4)(b) whether it is reasonable in all the circumstances to comply with the request without the consent of the other individual concerned  regard shall be had  in particular  to‚Äî  (a)any duty of confidentiality owed to the other individual  (there is no duty on your part to the fraudster)

Good morning Tesco.  I would just like to remind you of an incident that happened with one of your Durrington delivery drivers.  On arrival at my place of work he was asked whether my car should be moved as there was only a small gap for him to pass through with his trolley.  He said it wasn t necessary.  At this time my front number plate was still attached to my car.  After delivering two trollies of food  it was in his hand.  He told a colleague he may have caught it with his trolley.  When I spoke to him about it he turned into a comedian  i quote  shall I phone Tesco and get them to send you some double sided sticky tape   and with that he left.  I telephoned customer services who said they would investigate and call back.  They did not.  I telephoned again and was informed I would be contacted in 24 hours.  Whilst on this second phone call  the customer services agent contacted Durrington and they spoke to the driver.  I was then informed that the driver denied knocking off my number plate.  And that was that.  the driver s word over mine and my colleagues.  No further contact at all.  the business I work for spend thousands of pounds a year shopping on line and you think it is acceptable to ignore the damage that one of your drivers has caused to my car.  When I am next in work  I shall inform my boss of your  less than customer focused  customer service.

Its a big fault with them that has never been corrected.  Machines all need updating with a better design with less faults. The amount of time people call staff due to faults is immense.

Today I stopped at your petrol station on the bentrim road in lisburn (NI) and encountered one of your employees who I can only describe as a delight. He was incredibly patient with my 10 month old son who refused to hand over his packet of mini cheddars to be scanned and insisted on carrying my items to the car for me  completely unaware of the fact that I have a disability which makes holding even a cup of tea a challenge. Due to the combined effort of my torture of a child who refuses to ever sleep and the many special breeds of idiot I d encountered driving on the road I was actually so flustered that I forgot to even put petrol in my car and left with a soggy packet of mini cheddars and some snacks to keep me going through what is probably going to be yet another sleepless night. However  despite not having remembered to get the petrol I needed this was a very enjoyable experience and I hope my thanks can be passed on to this fantastic gentleman who went out of his way to make my day that little bit easier.  Kind regards  A very grateful tired mummy

Tesco  I have to give credit where it is due. I was at Ryde Tesco Extra on the Isle of Wight earlier and was browsing the new extended Free From aisle. A staff member made a point of approaching me and asking what I thought of the new range.   I nodded my approval but did mention that I thought there were too many ready made products and not enough staple ingredients for those who want to make our own without the sugar laden extras - e.g you stock several brands and ranges of gluten free bread and rolls but only 3 different bags of GF flour (Doves plain  SR and bread flour).   I went on to say that I often go to Morrisons purely because they stock Doves Farm rice flours and gram flour. This staff member listened carefully to everything I said  made notes and when I explained that Gram flour is actually chickpea flour she seemed really pleased  saying that several customers had asked for chickpea flour but it was hard to find with suppliers and that this new information could really help.  I have to say that it was a very refreshing touch to have staff discussing with customers what they think - please do encourage more staff to do this sort of thing. As a coeliac  shopping can be mired in frustration (e.g you sell a gluten free fresh baked bread stick....but store it in amongst the other regular fresh baked goods so a true coeliac could still not eat it because of cross contamination) so this conversation did leave me continuing this shopping with a smile on my face...well done to that employee!
