I m writing this on behalf of my Nan. My nan shops in the Tesco Cheam park farm branch every week and she goes to a specific cashier every week. The reason she goes to this paticular lady is because she gives fantastic service. She packs every one of my nans bags and lifts them into the trolley for her because through conversation she has learnt that my nan has a very week shoulder. If my nan has forgotten something she will go get it for her  she literally cannot do enough. My nan just rang me to tell me that a delivery driver turned up on her door today with the most beautiful bunch of flowers and it was from the cashier Catherine Caffrey. She sent them as she knows again through talking to my nan that she is having a tough time with my grandad who has parkinsons and slight dementia and she wanted to send them to cheer her up. I actually work for Tesco at another store as a manager and used to know Catherine years ago when I worked with her as a team leader but regardless of this I feel what she has done is truly touching and amazing. My nan has done the customer view point before to commend Catherine on service but I don t believe she got the recognition she deserved. Well done Catherine caffrey my nan thinks your a star x

However you can imagine my horror today when I took the potato salad back out of the fridge to eat with leftovers  only to realise the use by date was in fact 30th July......the day BEFORE I purchased it from your store. So thanks to someone not doing their job properly (perhaps feeling a little peaky after a heavy Saturday night)  I inadvertently fed all of my BBQ guests out of date potato salad. Luckily we ve all survived to tell the tale  and no one appears to have been taken ill  but nevertheless I m not impressed!!

Dear Tesco  Last night i saw some nerf on offer 2 for ¬£15 on Tesco direct. But i have and i can see your fine array of goods on the shelves ready for me to purcahse! its payday morning and i have an ambush planned for tonight! ( Which is already there ) Go back in to the same shop to pick up stock thats now in ( which technically was on the shelf yesterday by the time i get back in )  This just annoys customers  wastes your staff time explaining this and wastes my time doing a return journey.  Paul ( Not nerfing my daughter tonight ) Howland 39y8m  ps. Dont worry the ambush is still planned just delayed to when the STOCK COMES IN!  pps. REALLY UNHAPPY with tesco mobile.  Brought kids a phone each  1 December and 1 January.  Got tesco sim cards from tesco north brackell.  Both times I explained we were moving to Cornwall and needed my kids to be contactable. Salesman assured me phones would work. Guess what. We ve been here almost 2 months and the phones are as good as useless. The kids have no reception at all. They cannot use their phones. Most areas of Cornwall are not covered by reception for them.  I ve another year of paying for phones that cannot be used. I ve left it till now so we can check reception around Cornwall.  It s disgusting. ¬£30 a month for NOTHING. I ve either got to start up a new contract with another company and pay you or not have reception for my kids. I m not happy at all.

DON T BUY A TELEVISION FROM TESCO. We bought a Toshiba television just over a year ago and it s just stopped working; the TV is in excellent condition. I looked on the internet to see whether there was a solution to getting the TV working again and I discovered that Toshiba TV s are notorious for switching off and on randomly and just breaking. So Tesco stock a brand that they must know is defective because they do their research on products before selling them.  I contacted Tesco who gave me an email address to send the details to and was told they d be in touch. They didn t bother to get in touch  I contacted them again a few days later where a decision on my television had been made (they just didn t bother to contact me to tell me what the outcome was). According to Tesco there is no guarantee that a television will last more than a year; really?  They have offered me just over a third of what the television is worth and I m expected to fork out the rest. I was given no option of a repair or replacement and no explanation what was wrong with the TV (these are technical experts who work in this department apparently). I asked to have the contract details to lodge a complaint and according to the person I spoke to there is no avenue to complain other than Trading Standards.  Trading Standards told me to go in-store where the TV was bought from and ask to see their terms and conditions  read them then make a formal complaint to Tesco; I did and the girl on the customer desk looked confused  had to ask a colleague who informed us they were wrote on the back of the receipt; they re not. I went on their website and searched for television terms and conditions and only t&c s for special offers came up. I then searched just terms and conditions and they came up but only related to statutory rights where a third party seller is involved.  Tesco clearly don t care about selling potential defective goods to their customer s. They still stock Toshiba with it s known television faults  I expect they buy the televisions with a known defect at a very low price and in my opinion intentionally rip their customers off. I won t be shopping their again and I ll be sure to tell people why.
